title: Bomb Threat At Jammu's Republic Day Venue Turns Out To Be Hoax
summary: Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha is scheduled to unfurl the national flag and take salute at the march past at the M A Stadium, the venue for the main Republic Day function in the Union Territory.
full_content: Bomb Threat At Jammu's Republic Day Venue Turns Out To Be Hoax Agency: PTI Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 09:54 IST Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha is scheduled to unfurl the national flag and take salute at the march past at the M A Stadium, the venue for the main Republic Day function in the Union Territory. reset Follow us on Google News They said a special team was also constituted to identify and arrest the culprits who have sent the e-mail. (File) A bomb threat prompted a thorough search at the main Republic Day venue here in Jammu and Kashmir, hours before the start of the function, officials said on Sunday. However, the threat received through e-mail late Saturday, proved to be a hoax, the officials said. related stories Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha is scheduled to unfurl the national flag and take salute at the march past at the M A Stadium, the venue for the main Republic Day function in the Union Territory. Chief Minister Omar Abdullah is also attending the function as the chief guest. The officials said the threat e-mail was sent from a username “Dise Lish" to the official mail accounts of various departments including secretary higher education and director higher education on Saturday night. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all The e-mail prompted deployment of multiple teams of bomb disposal squad at the stadium which was thoroughly searched in presence of senior police officers throughout the night, the officials said, adding nothing incriminating was found during the searches. They said a special team was also constituted to identify and arrest the culprits who have sent the e-mail. (This story has not been edited by News18 staff and is published from a syndicated news agency feed - PTI ) tags : bomb hoax jammu and kashmir manoj sinha republic day Location : Jammu, India First Published: January 26, 2025, 09:53 IST News india Bomb Threat At Jammu's Republic Day Venue Turns Out To Be Hoax Read More

title: American Singer Mary Millben Extends Greetings On Republic Day, Sings Indian National Anthem To Wish Indians | Watch
summary: Mary Millben is the singer who performed the Indian national anthem at the Ronald Reagan Building in Washington DC in 2023.
full_content: American Singer Mary Millben Extends Greetings On Republic Day, Sings Indian National Anthem To Wish Indians | Watch Curated By : Shobhit Gupta News18.com Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 09:38 IST Mary Millben is the singer who performed the Indian national anthem at the Ronald Reagan Building in Washington DC in 2023. reset Follow us on Google News International singer Mary Millben. (File) Renowned African-American actress and singer Mary Millben on Sunday greeted India and the fellow citizens on the occasion of the country’s 76th Republic Day and joined the virtual global celebration by singing National Anthem. “To His Excellency @narendramodi, Her Excellency @rashtrapatibhvn, the Indian Allied Forces, my beloved India, and Indian communities across the world, Happy 76th Republic Day! Let’s sing together!" she said. related stories To His Excellency @narendramodi , Her Excellency @rashtrapatibhvn , the Indian Allied Forces, my beloved India, and Indian communities across the world, Happy 76th Republic Day!Let’s sing together! 🇺🇸🇮🇳 #RepublicDay #India #PMModi @PMOIndia @mygovindia @BJP4India @iccr_hq pic.twitter.com/sVEpoSrrCU — Mary Millben (@MaryMillben) January 25, 2025 Millben has been a supporter and well-wisher of India and has been lauding PM Modi’s efforts to bring peace as a world leader. She is the singer who performed the Indian national anthem at the Ronald Reagan Building in Washington DC in 2023. Following her performance, she touched the feet of PM Modi to seek his blessings, attracting huge media attention. Millben previously performed at the 2020 Diwali celebrations where she performed Om Jai Jagdish Hare. A former White House Presidential Appointee to George W Bush, Millben has performed for world leaders and three US presidents – Barack Obama and Donald Trump. The singer has used her music as a tool to promote peace and friendship globally. India’s 76th Republic Day Celebrations As the nation comes together to celebrate the pride and spirit of Republic Day today (January 26), Kartavya Path in the heart of the capital will host a grand parade showcasing India’s strength and unity. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all The parade will feature contingents from the Indian Armed Forces and paramilitary forces, with a total of 18 marching units, 15 bands, and 31 tableaux on display. It will begin at 10:30 am. Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto will be the chief guest for the occasion. At least 10,000 special guests have been invited from across the country and a total of 7,70,000 passes and tickets have been issued. tags : India Mary Millben republic day Location : New York, United States of America (USA) First Published: January 26, 2025, 09:33 IST News india American Singer Mary Millben Extends Greetings On Republic Day, Sings Indian National Anthem To Wish Indians | Watch Read More

title: UP Advocate Pleading Sister's Divorce Kidnapped, Crushed To Death; Estranged Brother-In-Law Held
summary: By the time the police got information about the kidnapping, the accused brutally thrashed Yadav and threw him on the road in the Walterganj area.
full_content: UP Advocate Pleading Sister's Divorce Kidnapped, Crushed To Death; Estranged Brother-In-Law Held Curated By : Shobhit Gupta News18.com Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 09:05 IST By the time the police got information about the kidnapping, the accused brutally thrashed Yadav and threw him on the road in the Walterganj area. reset Follow us on Google News The advocate was pleading for his sister in her divorce case, police said. (Pixabay/representative) In a shocking incident, a 50-year-old advocate was allegedly kidnapped, beaten up and then crushed to death under a vehicle in Uttar Pradesh’s Basti district The police have arrested his estranged brother-in-law in connection with the case. related stories The 50-year-old advocate, Chandrashekhar Yadav, a resident of Baidolia Ajaib in Kaptanganj police station area, had gone to attend a ‘Thana Samadhan Diwas’ event on Saturday when some miscreants, driving a Scorpio, kidnapped him while returning home on a bike, reported news agency PTI as quoted by the police. By the time the police got information about the kidnapping, the accused brutally thrashed Yadav and threw him on the road in the Walterganj area. The accused then ran over him with their vehicle and fled, a senior police official said. Basti Superintendent of Police (SP) Abhinandan said the advocate’s sister and her husband Ranjeet Yadav were going through a divorce and he was pleading the case. The police suspect the crime to have been committed in connection with the same. There was a dispute over the financial aspect of the divorce settlement due to which Ranjit and his brother Sandeep kidnapped the advocate and killed him, the SP told the news agency. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Ranjit Yadav, the main accused in the case has been arrested and police teams have been deployed to arrest the other accused, the officer added. Upon getting information about the incident, a large number of advocates reached the hospital and demanded the arrest of the killers. tags : Basti uttar pradesh police Location : Basti, India First Published: January 26, 2025, 09:05 IST News india UP Advocate Pleading Sister's Divorce Kidnapped, Crushed To Death; Estranged Brother-In-Law Held Read More

title: Happy Republic Day 2025: Heartfelt Wishes, Images, Quotes, Messages And WhatsApp Status To Share
summary: Republic Day 2025: India marks its 76th Republic Day this year on January 26. Here are some heartfelt wishes, messages, greetings, patriotic quotes and images to share with your family, friends, colleagues and boss to invoke a feeling of gratitude for our nation.
full_content: Happy Republic Day 2025: Heartfelt Wishes, Images, Quotes, Messages And WhatsApp Status To Share Published By : Nibandh Vinod Trending Desk Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 09:00 IST Republic Day 2025: India marks its 76th Republic Day this year on January 26. Here are some heartfelt wishes, messages, greetings, patriotic quotes and images to share with your family, friends, colleagues and boss to invoke a feeling of gratitude for our nation. reset Follow us on Google News Happy Republic Day 2025: Wishes, images, messages, quotes and photos to share with your loved ones on Gantantra Diwas. (Image: Shutterstock) HAPPY REPUBLIC DAY 2025 WISHES, QUOTES, STATUS, MESSAGES: India is celebrating its 76th Republic Day today on January 26, 2025, with great pomp and show across the country. It day marks the anniversary of the formal adoption of the Constitution of India on January 26, 1950, making the country a democratic republic. On this occasion, India stands poised as the tricolour unfurls and the national anthem plays to celebrate the achievements of our nation and pay tribute to the sacrifices of our freedom fighters who made this possible. ALSO READ: Happy Republic Day Wishes 2025: Quotes, Messages And WhatsApp Status to Share related stories The main highlight of this day is the grand parade at Kartavya Path in New Delhi which every citizen excitedly awaits. This parade showcases the cultural and military diversity of India, as various states and union territories take part, displaying their folk dances, tableaux and music. Read below to explore the wishes, quotes, and messages in English that capture the essence of the Indian Republic. Let us celebrate the spirit of India—a land of diverse cultures, traditions, and languages. United we stand, proud and strong. Jai Hind! Happy Republic Day Wishes In Marathi: Happy Republic Day to every Indian! Let’s honour the sacrifices made for our nation’s independence and work towards a brighter future. (Image: Shutterstock) May the vibrant hues of freedom paint your day, and the spirit of unity weave joy in every way. Happy Republic Day 2025! On this Republic Day, let us salute the brave souls who laid down their lives for our freedom and dignity. Let us pay homage to the architects of our Constitution who gave us the rights and duties of citizenship. Happy Republic Day 2025! Republic Day Wishes 2025: On this Republic Day, let’s remember the heroes who gave us the gift of freedom. Wishing you peace, prosperity, and pride in our great nation. (Image: Shutterstock) As we hoist the tricolour high, let’s fill our hearts with pride and strive to build a nation that forever thrives. Happy Republic Day 2025 to all my fellow Indians! Wishing you a very Happy Republic Day 2025. May this day bring happiness to all the countrymen. Happy Republic Day 2025 Wishes: Warm wishes on Republic Day! May we continue to cherish the principles of justice, liberty, and equality that form the foundation of our democracy. (Image: Shutterstock) Let the tricolour flutter high, echoing our freedom’s cry! I wish you a Happy Republic Day 2025, filled with unity, pride, and progress. May the torch of freedom shine ever bright as we march towards a future, bold and full of light. Happy Republic Day 2025! Republic Day Greetings! May this day remind us of the progress we’ve made and the journey ahead towards a more inclusive and prosperous India. Happy Republic Day 2025 to you and your loved ones. title: Republic Day 2025: Kerala Lottery Akshaya AK-687 Draw for 26 January Postponed
summary: The Kerala Lottery Department has announced that the regular lucky draw scheduled for January 26 will not take place. Consequently, the highly anticipated Akshaya AK-687 draw has been postponed.
full_content: Republic Day 2025: Kerala Lottery Akshaya AK-687 Draw for 26 January Postponed Published By : News Desk Trending Desk Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 09:04 IST The Kerala Lottery Department has announced that the regular lucky draw scheduled for January 26 will not take place. Consequently, the highly anticipated Akshaya AK-687 draw has been postponed. reset Follow us on Google News Kerala Lottery lucky draw for 26 January, 2025 have been postponed. (Image: Shutterstock) In observance of India’s 76th Republic Day , the Kerala Lottery Department has announced that there will be no regular lucky draw on January 26. As a result, the much-awaited draw for Akshaya AK-687 will be postponed. The next draw will be held on Monday, January 27 for the Win Win W-806 lottery. The winner of the first prize will get Rs 75 lakh. Make sure to check this space tomorrow for your chance to win big! ALSO READ: Kerala Lottery Results: Win Win W-806 Winners For 27 January, 2025; First Prize Rs 75 Lakh! related stories WIN WIN W- 806 LOTTERY: PRIZE STRUCTURE 1st Prize: Rs 75 Lakh 2nd Prize: Rs. 5 Lakh 3rd Prize: Rs. 1 Lakh 4th Prize: Rs. 5,000 5th Prize: Rs. 2,000 6th Prize: Rs. 1,000 7th Prize: Rs. 500 Consolation Prize: Rs. 8,000 HOW TO VERIFY LOTTERY RESULTS? To confirm the lottery results and winning numbers, go to the official website at www.keralalottery.info . The Kerala Government Gazette Office also has access to the results. HOW TO COLLECT YOUR PRIZE MONEY? To find out if you won, compare the numbers on your ticket with those in the Kerala Government Gazette. You can get your prize if the number on your ticket matches one of the winning numbers that were revealed. Within 30 days following the draw, winners must come to the Kerala Lottery offices in Thiruvananthapuram to pick up their prize. To verify and pick up your prize, make sure you have the winning ticket and proper identification with you. DOCUMENTS REQUIRED TO CLAIM PRIZE MONEY? It is necessary to have a self-attested photocopy of the winning ticket that is signed on both sides. Two passport-sized photos that have been approved and signed by a Gazette official must be submitted. A second copy of the participant’s PAN card should be provided. Fill out the prize claim form online, including a revenue stamp, and send it in. Show legitimate identity, such as a voter ID, PAN card, ration card, Aadhaar, or a comparable document. HOW TO DOWNLOAD A PDF WITH A FULL LIST OF WINNING NUMBERS? Go to keralalotteries.info or keralalotteryresult.net, the official website for the Kerala Lottery. To check the lottery result click the link. The screen will show up the winning numbers. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all On the website, look for the download option. title: Shillong Sunday Teer Result, January 26, 2025 LIVE: Check Winning Numbers for First and Second Rounds
summary: Shillong Sunday Teer Result Today, January 26, 2025: Check the full list of common and winning numbers for the Morning Teer gamnes. In view of Republic Day, most Shillong Teer games will not be held today.
full_content: Shillong Sunday Teer Result, January 26, 2025 LIVE: Check Winning Numbers for First and Second Rounds Published By : News Desk Trending Desk Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 08:30 IST Shillong Sunday Teer Result Today, January 26, 2025: Check the full list of common and winning numbers for the Morning Teer gamnes. In view of Republic Day, most Shillong Teer games will not be held today. reset Follow us on Google News Shillong Teer is a legal archery-based lottery played in Meghalaya. (Image: Shutterstock) SHILLONG SUNDAY TEER RESULT TODAY, JANUARY 26, 2025 LIVE UPDATES: The Khasi Hills Archery Sports Association organises Shillong Teer, a unique lottery game managed by the Meghalaya Lottery Department. Hosted daily at the Shillong Polo Stadium, this event promotes archery among the youth while offering participants the chance to win exciting prizes. However, in view of Republic Day, most Shillong Teer games will not be held today. Below are the winning numbers for the Shillong Morning Teer and Juwai Morning Teer games. WINNING NUMBERS FOR JANUARY 26 related stories SHILLONG SUNDAY MORNING TEER First Round Result at 10:30 am Second Round Result at 11:30 am JUWAI SUNDAY MORNING TEER RESULT First Round Result at 10:30 am Second Round Result at 11:30 am HOW TO PLAY SHILLONG LOTTERY? There are two rounds in the game, and each one lasts exactly two minutes. In the first round, archers shoot 30 arrows, and in the second, 20. In one or both rounds, players bet on the number of arrows that will strike the target. Participants predict by selecting a number between 0 and 99. If the chosen number coincides with the outcome of any round, the player wins. Authorised merchants sell tickets for Rs 1, Rs 5, Rs 10, Rs 20, or Rs 50. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all In the Shillong Teer lottery, the reward amount is determined by the total number of bets placed and the precision of the participant’s accuracy. For instance, in the first round, a Rs 1 bet can yield a reward of Rs 80, while the same bet in the second round offers Rs 60. If a contestant accurately predicts the outcomes of both rounds with a Rs 1 wager each, they stand to earn up to Rs 4,000. The Khasi Hills Archery Sports Association (KHASA) depends on these special lottery games for money and assistance. Results are posted on meghalayateer.com and the official KHASA website. In addition, Meghalaya conducts daily Teer lotteries, including Khanapara Teer, Jowai Teer, and Ladrymbai Teer. To view the most recent information and winning numbers, visit the official designated website. tags : Shillong Shillong lottery Shillong Lottery Result Shillong Teer Location : Shillong, India First Published: January 26, 2025, 08:30 IST News india Shillong Sunday Teer Result, January 26, 2025 LIVE: Check Winning Numbers for First and Second Rounds Read More

title: Shah Rukh Khan To Get Rs 9 Crore Refund From State For 'Mannat'
summary: The Maharashtra Government would be refunding Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan Rs 9 crore that he had paid in excess to convert the lease of his seafacing bungalow `Mannat'.
full_content: Shah Rukh Khan To Get Rs 9 Crore Refund From State For 'Mannat' Agency: PTI Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 08:22 IST The Maharashtra Government would be refunding Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan Rs 9 crore that he had paid in excess to convert the lease of his seafacing bungalow `Mannat'. reset Follow us on Google News Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan (File) The Maharashtra Government would be refunding Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan Rs 9 crore that he had paid in excess to convert the lease of his sea-facing bungalow `Mannat’. Resident suburban collector Satish Bagal said on Saturday that in 2019, Shah rukh Khan and his wife Gauri Khan converted the lease of the heritage property in Bandra to `class 1 complete ownership’, and paid the government some premium for it. related stories After discovering a tabulation error on the basis of which the premium was calculated, the Khans filed an application before the revenue authority for refund which was sanctioned earlier this week, he said. The actor had reportedly paid upwards of Rs 25 crore in premium, but officials did not confirm the figure immediately. (This story has not been edited by News18 staff and is published from a syndicated news agency feed - PTI ) tags : Maharashtra government Mannat Shah Rukh Khan Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 26, 2025, 08:22 IST News movies Shah Rukh Khan To Get Rs 9 Crore Refund From State For 'Mannat' Read More

title: Republic Day 2025: At 21, CRPF Bags Highest Number Of Gallantry Medals
summary: A total of 95 bravery medals have been awarded to the personnel of state and central police forces, fire service, home guard and civil defence and correctional services through an order issued by the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA).
full_content: Republic Day 2025: At 21, CRPF Bags Highest Number Of Gallantry Medals Agency: PTI Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 08:13 IST A total of 95 bravery medals have been awarded to the personnel of state and central police forces, fire service, home guard and civil defence and correctional services through an order issued by the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA). reset Follow us on Google News The CRPF, with about 3.25 lakh personnel, is the mainstay for internal security duties in the country. The CRPF has been awarded the highest number of police gallantry medals, 21, among all central and state police forces including two defence ministry issued Shaurya Chakras on the eve of the 76th Republic Day on Saturday. A total of 95 bravery medals have been awarded to the personnel of state and central police forces, fire service, home guard and civil defence and correctional services through an order issued by the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA). related stories The Ministry of Defence also announced two Shaurya Chakras for the CoBRA commandos of the force — Deputy Commandant Vikrant Kumar and Inspector Jeffrey Hmingchullo — for undertaking a daring operations against Maoists in Jharkhand during 2023. As per their citation, these personnel from the 203 Commando Battalion for Resolute Action (CoBRA) displayed "exceptional" bravery during an anti-Naxal operation that took place on April 2, 203 in Chatra district of the state leading to the killing of five "top" Maoists and recovery of a cache of weapons and ammunition. The Shaurya Chakra is the third highest peacetime military gallantry medal. A senior officer of the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) said that out of the 19 police medals for gallantry (GM), 11 are for operations undertaken in Jammu and Kashmir, seven for acts of bravery in anti-Maoist operations and one for courage displayed during an operation in the northeast. The awardees include second-in-command rank officer Narender Yadav, and Assistant Commandants Amit Kumar and Vinay Kumar who have been conferred with the 1st bar to GM (gallantry medal awarded for the second time). Late Constable Sunil Kumar Pandey has been named for the medal posthumously. The 186th battalion jawan laid down his life in September 2023 in Assam while stopping bike-borne smugglers who trafficked contraband from Assam to Arunachal Pradesh. The assailants attacked him with a knife. After the CRPF, the country’s largest paramilitary force, the highest number of medals went to Uttar Pradesh (17), Jammu and Kashmir (15), Chhattisgarh (11) and Border Security Force (5). Three Border Security Force (BSF) personnel deployed under the United Nations (UN) flag in Congo have also been honoured with the gallantry medal. Inspector Jitu Deori, Constable Ratan Kumar Yogi and Constable Awdhesh Kumar Yadav displayed "exemplary courage" in rescuing 38 unarmed UN staff members from a violent mob that attacked their camp in Butembo on July 26, 2022. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all The BSF is primarily tasked with guarding Indian borders with Pakistan and Bangladesh apart from rendering a variety of other security duties. The CRPF, with about 3.25 lakh personnel, is the mainstay for internal security duties in the country. (This story has not been edited by News18 staff and is published from a syndicated news agency feed - PTI ) tags : CRPF Gallantry Awards mha Padma awards republic day Location : New Delhi, India First Published: January 26, 2025, 08:13 IST News india Republic Day 2025: At 21, CRPF Bags Highest Number Of Gallantry Medals Read More

title: Republic Day 2025 Updates: India's Grand Military Might & Rich Heritage Showcased In Parade At Kartavya Path
summary: Republic Day 2025 Updates: The parade kicked off at 10:30 am from Kartavya Path, with PM Narendra Modi and President Droupadi Murmu leading the ceremonies.
full_content: Live now Republic Day 2025 Updates: India's Grand Military Might & Rich Heritage Showcased In Parade At Kartavya Path Curated By : News Desk News18.com Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 22:38 IST Republic Day 2025 Updates: The parade kicked off at 10:30 am from Kartavya Path, with PM Narendra Modi and President Droupadi Murmu leading the ceremonies. reset Follow us on Google News Arrow formation comprising of five Jaguar aircraft fly past over Kartavya Path. Happy Republic Day 2025 Updates : As the nation comes together to celebrate the pride and spirit of Republic Day today (January 26), Kartavya Path in the heart of the capital hosts a grand parade showcasing India’s strength and unity. The parade features contingents from the Indian Armed Forces and paramilitary forces, with a total of 18 marching units, 15 bands, and 31 tableaux on display. The event began with Prime Minister Narendra Modi performing a wreath-laying ceremony at the National War Memorial followed by President Droupadi Murmu unfurling the Indian flag at Kartavya Path, marking the start of the Republic Day parade. Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto will be the chief guest for the occasion. At least 10,000 special guests have been invited from across the country and a total of 7,70,000 passes and tickets have been issued. Each year, the government selects a theme for the Republic Day celebrations, and this year’s theme is “ Swarnim Bharat: Virasat aur Vikas ” (Golden India: Heritage and Progress). title: Happy Republic Day 2025: 76+ Inspiring Quotes And Slogans By Freedom Fighters!
summary: Happy Republic Day Quotes: India marks its 76th Republic Day this year on January 26. Celebrate the day with 76+ inspiring quotes and slogans by freedom fighters, along with motivational quotes for students
full_content: Happy Republic Day 2025: 76+ Inspiring Quotes And Slogans By Freedom Fighters! Published By : Nibandh Vinod Trending Desk Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 09:05 IST Happy Republic Day Quotes: India marks its 76th Republic Day this year on January 26. Celebrate the day with 76+ inspiring quotes and slogans by freedom fighters, along with motivational quotes for students reset Follow us on Google News Happy Republic Day 2025: Celebrate Republic Day 2025 with inspiring quotes, slogans, and motivation from freedom fighters and for students! (Image: Shutterstock) Happy Republic Day 2025: Republic Day, annually celebrated on January 26, marks the adoption of India’s constitution as the country transitioned to a republic in 1950. Although India gained independence in 1947, it became a sovereign state and was officially declared a Republic in 1950, when its Constitution came into effect. As we celebrate India’s 76th Republic Day today on January 26, here are some quotes/slogans by famous Indian freedom fighters to honour the country and its legacy. ALSO READ: Happy Republic Day 2025: Heartfelt Wishes, Images, Quotes, Messages And WhatsApp Status To Share related stories Republic Day 2025: Quotes By Freedom Fighters Republic Day Quote: “Freedom is not given; it is taken. Fight for your rights" – Lala Lajpat Rai. (Image: Shutterstock) “So long as you do not achieve social liberty, whatever freedom is provided by the law is of no avail to you" – BR Ambedkar. “Merciless criticism and independent thinking are the two necessary traits of revolutionary thinking." – Bhagat Singh. “Sarfaroshi ki tamanna ab hamare dil me hai, dekhna hai zor kitna baazu-e-qaatil me hai." – Bismil Azimabadi. “Let a new India arise out of peasants’ cottages, grasping the plough, out of huts, cobbler, and sweeper." – Swami Vivekananda. “Swaraj is my birthright and I shall have it." – Bal Gangadhar Tilak. “Freedom is not worth having if it does not include the freedom to make mistakes" – Mahatma Gandhi. “Democracy is not merely a form of government. It is primarily a mode of associated living, of conjoint communicated experience. It is essentially an attitude of respect and reverence towards fellow men" – BR Ambedkar. “Faith is the bird that feels the light when the dawn is still dark" – Rabindranath Tagore." “Arise, awake and stop not till the goal is reached" – Swami Vivekananda. “One individual may die for an idea, but that idea will, after his death, incarnate itself in a thousand lives" – Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose. “The sanctity of law can be maintained only so as long as it is the expression of the will of the people" – Bhagat Singh. “The shots that hit me are the last nails to the coffin of British rule in India" – Lala Lajpat Rai. “Let us all be brave enough to die the death of a martyr, but let no one lust for martyrdom." – Mahatma Gandhi “Satyameva Jayate" – Pandit Madan Mohan Malviya “Swaraj is my birthright, and I shall have it!" – Bal Gangadhar Tilak “I measure the progress of a community by the degree of progress which women have achieved." – BR Ambedkar. “We gain freedom when we have paid the full price" – Rabindranath Tagore “The preservation of freedom is not the task of soldiers alone. The whole nation has to be strong." – Lal Bahadur Shastri “Let new India arise out of peasants’ cottage, grasping the plough, out of huts, cobbler and sweeper." – Swami Vivekananda “A country’s greatness lies in its undying ideals of love and sacrifice that inspire the mothers of the race." – Sarojini Naidu “The shots that hit me are the last nails to the coffin of British rule in India" – Lala Lajpat Rai “Freedom is never dear at any price. It is the breath of life. What would a man not pay for living?" – Mahatma Gandhi “Knowledge with humility is worthless" – Pandit Madan Mohan Malviya “Freedom is the birthright of every nation." – Annie Besant “We will face the bullets of the enemy; we are free and will remain free" – Chandra Shekhar Azad “Freedom is not given; it is taken. Fight for your rights" – Lala Lajpat Rai “They may kill me, but they cannot kill my ideas. They can crush my body, but they will not be able to crush my spirit" – Bhagat Singh “An eye for an eye only ends up making the whole world blind" – Mahatma Gandhi. “‘Revolution’ does not necessarily involve sanguinary strife nor is there any place in it for individual vendetta. It is not the cult of the bomb and the pistol. By ‘Revolution’ we mean that the present order of things, which is based on manifest injustice, must change." – Bhagat Singh “Blood and tears are going to be our lot, whether we like them or not. Our blood and tears will flow; maybe the parched soil of India needs them so that the fine flower of freedom may grow again." –Jawaharlal Nehru “The highest education is that which does not merely give us information but makes our life in harmony with all existence." – Rabindranath Tagore “A nation’s culture resides in the hearts and the soul of its people." – Mahatma Gand...

title: Aaj Ka Panchang, 26 January, 2025: Tithi, Vrat, Shubh Muhurat, And Ashubh Muhurat
summary: Aaj Ka Panchang, January 26, 2025: Devotees will celebrate Shattila Ekadashi Parana today on Sunday.
full_content: Aaj Ka Panchang, 26 January, 2025: Tithi, Vrat, Shubh Muhurat, And Ashubh Muhurat Published By : News Desk Trending Desk Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 05:00 IST Aaj Ka Panchang, January 26, 2025: Devotees will celebrate Shattila Ekadashi Parana today on Sunday. reset Follow us on Google News Aaj Ka Panchang, January 26, 2025: The sun will rise at 7:12 AM and set at 5:56 PM. (Image: Shutterstock) AAJ KA PANCHANG, JANUARY 26, 2025: The Dwadashi and Trayodashi Tithis of Krishna Paksha will take place on Sunday, January 26. Festivals like Shattila Ekadashi Parana will be observed today nationwide. In Hinduism, the calendar is divided into Tithis, each of which has a distinct significance and influence on certain activities. Activities made during auspicious Tithis are believed to produce positive results, whereas activities held during unfavourable seasons may result in difficulties. SUNRISE, SUNSET, MOONRISE, AND MOONSET ON JANUARY 26 related stories As per Drik Panchang, the sun will rise at 7:12 AM and set at 5:56 PM. The moon is anticipated to rise at 5:29 AM on January 27 and set at 2:37 PM. TITHI, NAKSHATRA, AND RASHI DETAILS FOR JANUARY 26 After the Dwadashi Tithi ends at 8:54 PM, it will transit to Trayodashi Tithi. The Jyeshtha Nakshatra will be there till 8:26 AM and will then transit to Mula Nakshatra. The sun will stay in Makara Rashi, and the moon will be in Vrishchika Rashi upto 8:26 AM and will transit to Dhanu Rashi. SHUBH MUHURAT FOR JANUARY 26 The Brahma Muhurta will be held from 5:26 AM to 6:19 AM on this day, and the Pratah Sandhya Muhurta will be observed from 5:52 AM to 7:12 AM. The time frame for the Vijaya Muhurta is 2:21 PM to 3:04 PM. The Sayahna Sandhya Muhurta is scheduled from 5:56 PM to 7:15 PM, while the Godhuli Muhurta is scheduled from 5:53 PM to 6:20 PM. On January 27, the Nishita Muhurta is scheduled to take place from 12:07 AM to 1 AM. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all ASHUBH MUHURAT FOR JANUARY 26 The Yamaganda Muhurat is scheduled for 12:34 PM to 1:54 PM, and the Rahu Kalam Muhurat is scheduled for 4:35 PM to 5:56 PM. The Gulikai Kalam Muhurat is scheduled to take place from 3:15 PM to 4:35 PM. From 4:30 PM to 5:13 PM, the Dur Muhurat will be observed. In Raja, the Baana Muhurat will be observed from 3:40 AM till full night on January 27. tags : Aaj ka Panchang Aaj Ka Panchang 2025 Hindu Panchang Panchang Location : New Delhi, India First Published: January 26, 2025, 05:00 IST News india Aaj Ka Panchang, 26 January, 2025: Tithi, Vrat, Shubh Muhurat, And Ashubh Muhurat Read More

title: 'Bengal Govt's Criticism Made Me Famous Nationwide': Kartik Maharaj On Padma Shri Honour
summary: Kartik Maharaj recalled Mamata Banerjee’s criticism, where she alleged that some monks from the Bharat Sevashram Sangha were aiding the BJP in Lok Sabha elections.
full_content: 'Bengal Govt's Criticism Made Me Famous Nationwide': Kartik Maharaj On Padma Shri Honour Reported By : Kamalika Sengupta News18.com Edited By: Ronit Singh Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 00:34 IST Kartik Maharaj recalled Mamata Banerjee’s criticism, where she alleged that some monks from the Bharat Sevashram Sangha were aiding the BJP in Lok Sabha elections. reset Follow us on Google News Bharat Sevashram Sangha monk Kartik Maharaj | Image/CNN-News18 Padma Award 2025: Sevashram Sangha monk Kartik Maharaj, also known as Pradiptananda Maharaj, expressed gratitude to the central government for conferring him the Padma Shri award on Republic Day eve. Kartik Maharaj, a monk who found himself at the centre of a row between the Trinamool Congress (TMC) and the BJP in West Bengal during the Lok Sabha elections 2024, was among the nine recipients of the Padma Shri award from West Bengal. related stories Speaking exclusively to CNN-News18 , Kartik Maharaj recalled Mamata Banerjee’s criticism, where she alleged that some monks from the Bharat Sevashram Sangha were aiding the BJP in Lok Sabha elections, working against the TMC in the state. “I thank the Bengal government and the state ruling party. Their criticism of me and my work helped my efforts gain nationwide recognition. Their advertisements made me famous across India. Earlier, I was only known in Murshidabad, but now I am known nationwide," Maharaj told CNN-News18 . “People began to explore what I had done after hearing their (Mamata Banerjee’s) remarks. Everyone now knows about my work and who Swamiji is. For this, I sincerely thank Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee," he added. ‘Heartfelt Thanks To Centre’ Kartik Maharaj, the secretary of the Beldanga branch of the Bharat Sevashram Sangha in Murshidabad, expressed his heartfelt gratitude to the central government for honouring his welfare works with the Padma award. “Those who wear saffron do not seek awards, rewards, or appreciation. Our organisation, Bharat Sevashram Sangh, along with our hospital and school, will benefit greatly from this recognition," Maharaj said. “Thousands of people receive treatment here, and this award will serve as a major inspiration for all these efforts. I extend my heartfelt thanks to the Government of India. In Bengal, Swami Vivekanand ji began the mission of serving the people, and we are continuing that legacy, as envisioned by Bharat Sevashram Sangh founder Pranabananda Ji," he added. Caught In TMC, BJP Crossfire In May 2024, as national political tensions escalated ahead of the Lok Sabha elections, a Sevashram monk became the focal point of the TMC-BJP conflict in West Bengal. Kartik Maharaj sent a legal notice to Chief Minister and TMC supremo Mamata Banerjee, demanding an apology from the CM for her alleged defamatory comments about his organisation. His lawyer stated that the monk had dedicated his life to “humanity" and to modernising Hindu society while preserving the core values of ancient Hindu traditions. He referred to Banerjee’s purported remarks that some monks of the Bharat Sevashram Sangha and Ramakrishna Mission were allegedly working hand in hand with the BJP in the state and said, “The Chief Minister will never be able to prove her accusations. I am a monk, not a politician." top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Maharaj also took to the streets, launching a statewide protest demanding an apology from Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee. Who Is Kartik Maharaj? Kartik Maharaj joined the Bharat Sevashram Sangha as a teenager and became a leader in his early 20s. He was assigned to Beldanga, Murshidabad, where he developed an ashram and contributed to building schools and hospitals. He is also credited with promoting girls’ education in the region. Despite his significant social work, Kartik Maharaj asserts that he has never been involved in politics. Location : Kolkata, India First Published: January 26, 2025, 00:09 IST News india 'Bengal Govt's Criticism Made Me Famous Nationwide': Kartik Maharaj On Padma Shri Honour Read More

title: Maha Kumbh: DGCA Asks Airlines To Rationalise Airfares For Prayagraj Flights
summary: The DGCA asked airlines to rationalise airfares for flights to Prayagraj amid the Maha Kumbh amid concerns over higher air tickets on the route.
full_content: Maha Kumbh: DGCA Asks Airlines To Rationalise Airfares For Prayagraj Flights Agency: PTI Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 23:55 IST The DGCA asked airlines to rationalise airfares for flights to Prayagraj amid the Maha Kumbh amid concerns over higher air tickets on the route. reset Follow us on Google News The Maha Kumbh Mela kickstarted in Prayagraj on January 13. Aviation watchdog DGCA has asked airlines to rationalise airfares for flights to Prayagraj in view of the Maha Kumbh amid concerns over higher air tickets on the route. Airlines, including SpiceJet, are operating more flights to Prayagraj. related stories To meet increased demand for air travel, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has approved 81 additional flights in January, increasing the air connectivity to Prayagraj to 132 flights from across the country. In a post on X on Saturday, the regulator said that in view of the likely surge in demand, airlines have been urged to increase further capacity by adding flights and rationalise fares. In view of likely surge in demand, DG (CA) met airlines on 23 January 2025 and urged them to increase further capacity by adding flights and rationalize fares.— DGCA (@DGCAIndia) January 25, 2025 DGCA officials held a meeting with airline representatives on January 23 in this regard. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Bookings as well as airfares for flights to Prayagraj have jumped multi-fold as more people travel for the Maha Kumbh, with the air ticket prices rising up to 21 per cent for the Delhi-Prayagraj flights, an analysis by travel portal Ixigo showed earlier this month. The Maha Kumbh, which started on January 13, will conclude on February 26. title: Who Is Chandrakant Sompura? Ayodhya Ram Mandir Architect Conferred Padma Shri Award
summary: Chandrakant Sompura hails from a family of architects who have designed more than 200 temples across the country over centuries. He came up with the Ram Mandir design in 1987.
full_content: Who Is Chandrakant Sompura? Ayodhya Ram Mandir Architect Conferred Padma Shri Award Curated By : Aveek Banerjee News18.com Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 23:17 IST Chandrakant Sompura hails from a family of architects who have designed more than 200 temples across the country over centuries. He came up with the Ram Mandir design in 1987. reset Follow us on Google News Chandrakant Sompura, who designed the iconic Ram Temple in Ayodhya, was conferred the Padma Shri award. (Photo: X) The Central government on Saturday announced the list of recipients for Padma Awards 2025 on the eve of Republic Day. President Droupadi Murmu approved the conferment of 139 Padma awards, comprising seven Padma Vibhushan, 19 Padma Bhushan and 113 Padma Shri Awards. One of the Padma Shri recipients is Chandrakant Sompura, 81, the architect of the Ram Temple in Ayodhya. Sompura belongs to a family of temple architects who have designed over 200 such structures across the country over centuries. related stories It was Sompura’s grandfather Prabhashankar Sompura who designed the revived Somnath temple in Gujarat’s Prabhas Patan in 1949. The Sompura family has a long list of temple creations to their credit, including the Akshardham temple complex in Gujarat, the Swaminarayan Mandir in Mumbai and the famed Birla Mandir in Kolkata. According to Times Now, he is the 15th generation of a family that has been into designing temple architecture in India and abroad. The creation of the Birla Mandir in Kolkata had reported impressed the Vishwa Hindu Parishad’s (VHP) late president Ashok Singhal. Padma Awards 2025 Full List How Sompura Came Up With Ram Mandir Design? In an interview from 2020, Sompura revealed that he was contacted by Ashok Singhal through the Birla family to come up with a design for the Ram Temple in Ayodhya around 33 years ago. “We met and discussed the construction of the temple and had to go to Ayodhya to recce the land. With so much security present, I had to disguise myself as a devotee and measure the area with footsteps to make the masterplan," he told Outlook India . Chandrakant Sompura inspecting the construction work along with his team in 2023. (PTI) He came up with a design for the Ram Temple in 1987, which was agreed upon in a meeting of saints during the Kumbh Mela in 1990. The design of the Ram temple was later upgraded by Sompura and his sons Ashish and Nikhil. Ashish said the temple was created with a 3D structural analysis by the Central Building Research Institute in Roorkee to ensure that it could withstand strong earthquakes. The Sompura family later explained that the temple was constructed using a traditional interlocking stone process and that Larsen & Toubro, the company that was awarded the contract, had to be persuaded of this method, according to The Indian Express . The Ram Mandir, designed in the traditional Nagara architectural style, measures 380 feet in length, 250 feet in width and reaches a height of 161 feet. Within the temple, the sanctum sanctorum houses the childhood form of Bhagwan Shri Ram (the idol of Shri Ram Lalla), while on the first floor, there is Shri Ram Darbar. The consecration ceremony of Ram Lalla idol in Ayodhya was held on January 22 last year, marking the end of 500 years of exile for the Lord’s devotees in India and across the country. Prime Minister Narendra Modi took part in the ‘pran pratishtha’ rituals in the presence of Uttar Pradesh Governor Anandiben Patel, Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath and RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat. The consecration ceremony of Ram Lalla idol in Ayodhya was held on January 22 last year. (PTI) The first anniversary of the consecration of Ram Mandir in Ayodhya was celebrated as ‘Pratishtha Dwadashi’ on January 11, 2025. The construction work is due to be completed by June this year. Padma Awards 2025 Announced Today A total of 139 names were announced – seven for Padma Vibhushan, 19 for Padma Bhushan, and 113 for Padma Shri. The awardees were recognised for their excellence in diverse fields like art, social work, science, medicine, and more, highlighting their contributions across various sectors. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Medicine expert Duvvur Nageshwar Reddy from Telangana, retired Justice Jagdish Singh Khehar from Chandigarh, and late singer Sharda Sinha from Bihar were honoured with the Padma Vibhushan. Another name that caught everyone’s attention was Bhim Singh Bhavesh, a social worker from Bhojpur who worked tirelessly for the upliftment of the Musahar community, one of society’s most marginalised groups, for the past 22 years through his foundation Nayee Asha’. tags : Ayodhya Ram mandir Padma awards padma shri ram temple Location : New Delhi, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 23:17 IST News india Who Is Chandrakant Sompura? Ayodhya Ram Mandir Architect Conferred Padma Shri Award Read More

title: Israel Bans North Gaza Entry Over Hamas Not Releasing Hostage Yehud, Frees 200 Palestinian Prisoners
summary: On January 25, a Gaza ceasefire deal led to a prisoner swap, with four Israeli women hostages freed after 15 months in captivity. The women were paraded in Gaza City before returning home to Israel, while celebrations unfolded in Tel Aviv. Meanwhile, Israel released 200 Palestinian prisoners, with 70 deported to Egypt. Prominent among them was Mohammed al-Tous, held for nearly 40 years. Discussions are ongoing for the release of Arbel Yehud, with Israel and mediators hoping for a resolution before February 1. n18oc_crux

title: Water Woes For Bengaluru This Summer? Officials Share Concerns For Certain Areas
summary: Ram Prasath Manohar said South-East Bengaluru, Whitefield, and the outer city limits are likely to face highest water stress this summer.
full_content: Water Woes For Bengaluru This Summer? Officials Share Concerns For Certain Areas Published By : Shankhyaneel Sarkar PTI Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 22:55 IST Ram Prasath Manohar said South-East Bengaluru, Whitefield, and the outer city limits are likely to face highest water stress this summer. reset Follow us on Google News A view shows parched banks of Nallurahalli Lake, located on the eastern edges of Bengaluru. (IMAGE: REUTERS) Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board chairman Ram Prasath Manohar said on Saturday that areas like South-East Bengaluru, Whitefield, and the outer city limits, which are most dependent on groundwater, are likely to face the highest water stress this summer. BWSBB’s recent extensive scientific study to assess potential water shortages in the city has identified 80 wards in Bengaluru, including 110 villages, as highly dependent on groundwater and at high risk of water shortages, according to a release issued by the BWSSB. related stories “We urge residents, especially those in high-risk wards, to reduce their dependence on groundwater and switch to Cauvery water connections. The Cauvery Phase 5 Project has increased water availability, offering a sustainable solution for Bengaluru’s growing needs," added Manohar. The study was a “first of its kind in India" and was done in collaboration with the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Manohar said. According to him, it aims to address water shortages in the IT hub this summer. “This study is a major milestone in our efforts to ensure sustainable water management in Bengaluru. insights, we are better equipped to address challenges and implement effective solutions to meet the city’s water needs," said Manohar. The study has also projected groundwater level decline in various parts of Bengaluru, which relies heavily on borewells, extracting approximately 800 million litres of water daily. In central Bengaluru, the groundwater-level decline is projected at 5m, while in CMC areas, it would range between 10m and 15m. In the 110 villages that come under the jurisdiction of Bengaluru, the decline is projected at 20m-25m. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all The initiative, guided by Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar, included the formation of a special task force comprising IISc scientists and officials from the state and central groundwater development departments. Over the past six months, the task force has meticulously analysed Bengaluru’s water supply and groundwater data to prepare a sustainable action plan. (This story has not been edited by News18 staff and is published from a syndicated news agency feed - PTI ) tags : bengaluru water crisis Location : Bengaluru, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 22:55 IST News india Water Woes For Bengaluru This Summer? Officials Share Concerns For Certain Areas Read More

title: FIITJEE Blames Managing Partners For Delhi-NCR Centre Closures, Warns Legal Action
summary: On Friday, students and parents said several FIITJEE centres had shut down across Delhi-NCR and many teachers resigned, allegedly due to non-payment of salaries for months
full_content: FIITJEE Blames Managing Partners For Delhi-NCR Centre Closures, Warns Legal Action Agency: PTI Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 09:21 IST On Friday, students and parents said several FIITJEE centres had shut down across Delhi-NCR and many teachers resigned, allegedly due to non-payment of salaries for months reset Follow us on Google News According to FIITJEE's website, it runs 73 centres across the country, providing coaching for competitive exams to engineering aspirants. Amid the closure of several FIITJEE centres across Delhi-NCR, the institute on Saturday claimed the shutdown was the result of “mismanagement and desertion" by managing partners, and announced plans to pursue legal action against its competitors for alleged poaching of its faculty. On Friday, students and parents said several FIITJEE centres had unexpectedly shut down across Delhi-NCR and many teachers resigned, allegedly due to non-payment of salaries for months. related stories According to FIITJEE’s website, it runs 73 centres across the country, providing coaching for competitive exams to engineering aspirants. The institute said in a statement, “FIITJEE has not closed any centre as part of its own decision. Overnight desertion of the centre by the centre managing partner, along with the entire team, is the only reason for this force majeure type of condition." “The present turmoil in the institution is temporary. Company officials are working to resume operations at all places within a reasonable time," it added. FIITJEE denied allegations that many teachers left because of non-payment of salaries for months and attributed the situation to “a criminal conspiracy hatched by people with vested interests". “Our legal team is taking appropriate action against the malicious prosecutions lodged against us," it said. The institute alleged that it was a “victim of exploitation" by managing partners, which worsened its financial situation. “Owing to mismanagement and exploitation by managing partners, FIITJEE’s financial situation worsened in January 2024. The group CFO (Chief Financial Officer) forecast that after six months, the company might run into an operational cash crunch," it said. Highlighting the steps taken to address the situation, FIITJEE said, “In February 2024, the company questioned the core group as well as all managing partners and told them to optimise the excess manpower, improve work culture, and clearly outline the strategy for bouncing back from the situation." “Most of the managing partners did not take any action. In fact, even this situation was exploited by some managing partners to gain unfair advantage," it added. The institute also accused its competitors of engaging in unfair practices. “We are also going to take strict legal action against the unfair trade practices adopted by our competitors before civil and criminal courts," it said. Amid allegations about a competitor institute’s poaching of FIITJEE’s teachers, some faculty members said they left because of non-payment of salaries. The institute also urged the students not to fall for “misleading tactics" and offered an audit of its finances. “FIITJEE has a very robust system that produces results. Our results are the envy of every other coaching institute. Consistency in FIITJEE results has frustrated all our competitors. We urge every student to stay confident and not fall for any misleading tactics," it said. “You may also depute a chartered accountant to look into the affairs of any centre and we are confident that we will not only emerge innocent, but you will also realise that we too are a victim along with students and parents," FIITJEE added. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all The institute said the situation was temporary and that efforts were being made to stabilise operations. It assured the students and their parents that studies would continue without disruption. (This story has not been edited by News18 staff and is published from a syndicated news agency feed - PTI ) Location : New Delhi, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 22:37 IST News india FIITJEE Blames Managing Partners For Delhi-NCR Centre Closures, Warns Legal Action Read More

title: Amid Mahakumbh Surge, 8 In 10 Fliers Say They Paid High Airfares At Least Once In Past 12 Months
summary: Six in 10 fliers passengers surveyed want the government to introduce ceiling/upper limit for airline fares which is two times the standard fare, according to the survey
full_content: Amid Mahakumbh Surge, 8 In 10 Fliers Say They Paid High Airfares At Least Once In Past 12 Months Reported By : Local Circles News18.com Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 21:56 IST Six in 10 fliers passengers surveyed want the government to introduce ceiling/upper limit for airline fares which is two times the standard fare, according to the survey reset Follow us on Google News A total of 15,226 responded to this question. With the surge in fares for the ongoing Maha Kumbh, eight in 10 fliers said they have paid excessively high fare once or more in the past 12 months, according to a LocalCircles survey. Air fares to Prayagraj and Banaras in Uttar Pradesh have reported to have risen 300% to 600% as pilgrims flock in large numbers to take a dip in the Ganges during the ongoing Mahakumbh. Consumers are reporting airfares for Delhi to Prayagraj between Rs 20,000 – 30,000 and for Delhi to Varanasi between Rs 20,000 – 40,000. Many fliers have been trying alternate airports as flights to Prayagraj sell out. This is against the around Rs 5,000 for a one-way trip to these cities under normal circumstances. related stories The survey received over 30,000 responses from airline passengers located in 304 districts of India. While 61% respondents were men, 39% respondents were women. Around 41% respondents were from tier 1, 29% from tier 2 and 30% respondents were from tier 3, 4, 5 and rural districts. THE SURVEY The survey first asked air travelers, “How many times have you paid excessively high (1.5 times of standard fare or higher) airfare in the last 12 months?" Of the 15,226 who responded to this question, 41% stated “1-2 times"; 36% stated “3-5 times"; 2% stated “6 times or more"; 16% stated they “have never paid excessively high fare in the last 12 months" and 5% of respondents did not give a clear answer. 6 IN 10 WANT GOVT TO INTRODUCE CEILING/UPPER LIMIT Given the air travellers’ concerns, the survey asked, “What should the ceiling on airfares be so profiteering by airlines does not take place?" Of the 15,095 who responded to the question 50% stated “2X of standard fare"; 10% stated “3X of standard fare"; 22% stated “there should be no ceiling / upper limit to what an airline can charge for a particular segment" and 18% of respondents did not give a clear answer. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all To sum up, six in 10 fliers passengers surveyed want the government to introduce ceiling/upper limit for airline fares which is two times the standard fare. LocalCircles is a community social media platform that enables citizens and small businesses to escalate issues for policy and enforcement interventions and enables the government to make policies that are citizen and small business centric. Location : New Delhi, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 21:54 IST News india Amid Mahakumbh Surge, 8 In 10 Fliers Say They Paid High Airfares At Least Once In Past 12 Months Read More

title: Uttarakhand Set To Become First State To Implement UCC On January 27
summary: CM Pushkar Singh Dhami will also launch the UCC portal on the same day at 12:30 pm at the State Secretariat.
full_content: Uttarakhand Set To Become First State To Implement UCC On January 27 Curated By : News Desk News18.com Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 21:45 IST CM Pushkar Singh Dhami will also launch the UCC portal on the same day at 12:30 pm at the State Secretariat. reset Follow us on Google News Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami | File Image/PTI Uniform Civil Code: Uttarakhand is set to become the first state in independent India to implement the Uniform Civil Code (UCC), on January 27, a move that has stirred political debates and national attention. CM Pushkar Singh Dhami will also launch the UCC portal on the same day at 12:30 pm at the Secretariat. Uttarakhand will be the first state in independent India to implement UCC, said officials. related stories The Uttarakhand government already implemented the Uttarakhand Uniform Civil Code Act, 2024, establishing a streamlined framework for the creation and cancellation of wills and supplementary documents, known as codicils, under testamentary succession. Taking to X, Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami said that all the necessary preparations have been completed to implement UCC, which includes approval of the rules of the Act and training of the concerned officials. “UCC will bring uniformity in the society and ensure equal rights and responsibilities for all citizens. The Uniform Civil Code is just an offering made by our state in the great yagya being done by the Prime Minister to make the country a developed, organized, harmonious and self-reliant nation," he added. प्रिय प्रदेशवासियों,राज्य में 27 जनवरी 2025 से समान नागरिक संहिता (यूसीसी) लागू की जाएगी, जिससे उत्तराखंड स्वतंत्र भारत का पहला राज्य बनेगा जहां यह कानून प्रभावी होगा। यूसीसी लागू करने के लिए सभी आवश्यक तैयारियां पूरी कर ली गई हैं, जिसमें अधिनियम की नियमावली को मंजूरी और… — Pushkar Singh Dhami (@pushkardhami) January 25, 2025 The state government notified on Wednesday the UCC which contains clarity of legal provisions for marital conditions and protection of individual rights and social harmony, an official statement read. According to the state government, this act applies to the entire area of the state of Uttarakhand and is also effective on the residents of the state living outside Uttarakhand. The law applies to all residents of Uttarakhand, except Scheduled Tribes and protected authority-empowered persons and communities. This Act does not apply to the Scheduled Tribes (ST) notified under Article 342 and Article 366 (25) of the Constitution and protected authority-empowered persons and communities under Part XXI have also been excluded from its purview. To streamline and simplify the legal processes related to marriage, a public welfare system promoting the protection of individual rights and social harmony has been provided in the Uniform Civil Code Act, 2024 of Uttarakhand, the statement added. Under this, marriage can be solemnised only between those parties, none of whom has a living spouse, both are mentally capable of giving legal permission, the man should have completed at least 21 years of age and the woman 18 years of age and they should not be in the ambit of prohibited relationships. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Marriage rituals can be performed in any form under religious customs or legal provisions, but it is mandatory to register marriages taking place after the implementation of the Act within 60 days. Whereas marriages taking place from March 26, 2010, to the implementation of the Act will have to be registered within 6 months. Those who have already registered as per the prescribed standards, although they are not required to register again, will still have to acknowledge the registration done earlier. tags : Pushkar Singh Dhami ucc Uttarakhand Location : Uttarakhand (Uttaranchal), India First Published: January 25, 2025, 21:42 IST News india Uttarakhand Set To Become First State To Implement UCC On January 27 Read More

full_content: Suzuki Motor's Ex CEO, 100-Year-Old Freedom Fighter, Singer Arijit Singh To Get Padma Awards | Full List Curated By : Aveek Banerjee News18.com Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 07:29 IST Padma Awards 2025 Winners: The Awards are given in three categories - Padma Vibhushan, Padma Bhushan and Padma Shri. reset Follow us on Google News The Awards are given in various disciplines / fields of activities, viz.- art, social work, public affairs, science. and more. Padma Awards 2025 Announcement: The Centre announced the list of recipients for Padma Awards on Saturday on the eve of the Republic Day. The President approved the conferment of 139 Padma Awards, comprising seven Padma Vibhushan, 19 Padma Bhushan and 113 Padma Shri Awards. In the list of awardees, 23 were women and ten were from the category of foreigners/NRI/PIO/OCI. At least 13 people were awarded posthumously. related stories Congratulating all Padwa Awardees, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, “India is proud to honour and celebrate their extraordinary achievements. Their dedication and perseverance are truly motivating. Each awardee is synonymous with hardwork, passion and innovation, which has positively impacted countless lives. They teach us the value of striving for excellence and serving society selflessly." Congratulations to all the Padma awardees! India is proud to honour and celebrate their extraordinary achievements. Their dedication and perseverance are truly motivating. Each awardee is synonymous with hardwork, passion and innovation, which has positively impacted countless…— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) January 25, 2025 The Padma awards, among the country’s highest civilian honours, are conferred in three categories – Padma Vibhushan, Padma Bhushan, and Padma Shri. The Awards are given in various disciplines / fields of activities, viz.- art, social work, public affairs, science and engineering, trade and industry, medicine, literature and education, sports, civil service, etc. ‘Padma Vibhushan’ is awarded for exceptional and distinguished service; ‘Padma Bhushan’ for distinguished service of high order and ‘Padma Shri’ for distinguished service in any field. The awards are announced on the occasion of Republic Day every year. title: CM Yogi Adityanath's Vision: United Uttar Pradesh, Win For NDA In 2027, Trillion-Dollar Economy In 2029 | Full Transcript Of Exclusive Interview
summary: CM Yogi Interview: In an exclusive interview with Network18 Group Editor-in-Chief Rahul Joshi at the Maha Kumbh, Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath detailed his roadmap for the state and revealed his broader political philosophy, deeply rooted in Sanatan Dharma's principles of inclusivity and integrity
full_content: CM Yogi Adityanath's Vision: United Uttar Pradesh, Win For NDA In 2027, Trillion-Dollar Economy In 2029 | Full Transcript Of Exclusive Interview Curated By : News Desk CNN-News18 Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 00:45 IST CM Yogi Interview: In an exclusive interview with Network18 Group Editor-in-Chief Rahul Joshi at the Maha Kumbh, Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath detailed his roadmap for the state and revealed his broader political philosophy, deeply rooted in Sanatan Dharma's principles of inclusivity and integrity reset Follow us on Google News Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath during an exclusive interview with Network18 Group Editor-in-Chief Rahul Joshi at the Maha Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj. (Image/Screenshot) In an exclusive interview with Network18 Group Editor-in-Chief Rahul Joshi at the Maha Kumbh in Prayagraj on Saturday, Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath offered a comprehensive view of the massive spiritual gathering, political landscape, and his vision for India. Sitting in front of the holy confluence of the Ganga, Yamuna, and Saraswati rivers, Yogi Adityanath delved into multiple critical aspects of governance, spirituality, and cultural significance. Asserting that the Maha Kumbh 2025 stands as a testament to India’s spiritual heritage, the UP chief minister highlighted the event’s unprecedented scale. He anticipated that 40-45 crore devotees would participate in the 45-day congregation, transforming the gathering into a powerful symbol of national unity and cultural pride. related stories Beyond the religious spectacle, Yogi Adityanath revealed his broader political philosophy, deeply rooted in what he described as Sanatan Dharma’s principles of inclusivity and integrity. He discussed crucial topics ranging from economic development and welfare schemes to challenges like illegal immigration and the implementation of a uniform civil code. In conversation with Network18, the CM also provided insights into his personal journey —from a mathematics student to a sanyasi and now a prominent political leader — reflecting his belief in service to the nation and commitment to cultural preservation. Edited excerpts: RAHUL JOSHI: Yogi ji, thank you very much for giving this exclusive interview to News18. We are in the Maha Kumbh area today. We are looking at the gathering. The event is grand, unparalleled and spectacular. I would like to know a little about it from you. What went into organising such a big event and what is your message to the world? YOGI ADITYANATH: Rahul ji, firstly, I heartily welcome News18 and your team to the Maha Kumbh area. Whatever you are seeing in Prayagraj and Maha Kumbh Nagar is the concrete form of the vision of the respected Prime Minister Narendra Modi. India’s heritage should get its due respect. It is an example of how it is the responsibility of the government to respect the faith. The divine and grand Kumbh is a testament to this belief. Today’s generation is getting to know about the heritage of thousands of years and the older generation is taking pride in passing on India’s cultural heritage to its next generation so that they can protect it and take it forward in the same grand way. The images from the Maha Kumbh that you witness are the divine and grand form of the Sanatan Dharma. This is what Sanatana is known for. It is India’s tradition to organise such grand Kumbhs to uphold our cultural and spiritual legacy. Such events were started with this aim. This is the holy land of Prayagraj. Crores of devotees take a dip in the Triveni of Maa Ganga, Yamuna, and Saraswati in the presence of saints and get their share of punya (goodness). RAHUL JOSHI: I have been to the Kumbh earlier as well. In 2019, you organised a grand Ardh Kumbh, and I came there too. But the kind of crowd I am seeing this time is usually what we witness on the Mauni Amavasya Snaan. But now there is such a crowd every day. YOGI ADITYANATH: This gathering is a message of the unity of India. You are right. Usually, we would see huge crowds on Mauni Amavasya, but we are seeing similar numbers every day. In 2019, 4 crore devotees bathed in the Sangam on the day of Mauni Amavasya. This time, 4 crore devotees bathed in the Sangam on the day of Makar Sankranti itself. In the past 10 days, more than 10 crore devotees have taken a dip in the Sangam. Today, more than 2 crore devotees are in the Maha Kumbh area for the holy dip. This will go on till February 3. On Mauni Amavasya, we expect the crowds to multiply three to five times compared to 2019. RAHUL JOSHI: Three to five times! What is the total footfall you expect? YOGI ADITYANATH: In my estimate, the 45-day congregation at Maha Kumbh will see a footfall that will be equivalent to the third-largest population in the world…after India and China…in this temporary set-up. We expect 40-45 crore devotees will give the message of national unity through the holy dip at the Sangam. RAHUL JOSHI: Congratulations on this great gat...

title: Consumer Protection Watchdog Fines Vision IAS Rs 3 Lakh For ‘Deceptive Advertising’
summary: The CCPA fined Vision IAS Rs 3 lakh for deceptive ads about its students' civil services exam success, misleading consumers by withholding specific course details.
full_content: Consumer Protection Watchdog Fines Vision IAS Rs 3 Lakh For ‘Deceptive Advertising’ Published By : Shankhyaneel Sarkar PTI Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 20:44 IST The CCPA fined Vision IAS Rs 3 lakh for deceptive ads about its students' civil services exam success, misleading consumers by withholding specific course details. reset Follow us on Google News Misleading UPSC success claims by Vision IAS earn a Rs 3 lakh penalty. (IMAGE: X) The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has imposed a penalty of Rs 3 lakh on Vision IAS for deceptive advertising about its students’ success in the civil services examination. The authority found that Vision IAS deliberately withheld specific course information, creating a misleading impression about its success rates in such exams, a statement by Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food & Public Distribution said. related stories The institute’s advertisement claimed “10 in Top 10 selections in CSE 2020 from various programs of Vision IAS" and prominently displayed successful candidates and pictures. Vision IAS highlighted only the first rank student’s foundation course while concealing course details of nine other successful UPSC Civil Services Exam (CSE) 2020 candidates. Of the remaining nine successful candidates, one student took a foundation course, six of them opted for test series for preliminary and mains stage and two of them for Abhyaas test. The institute’s selective disclosure suggested all candidates followed the same course path, which was false. Courses ranged from Rs 750 for a mock test to Rs 1,40,000 for a full foundation course. The CCPA emphasized that complete course information is crucial for consumers to make informed decisions about coaching institutes. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all The commission imposed a penalty to protect “young and impressionable aspirants" from potentially deceptive marketing practices, the statement said. The CCPA has so far issued 46 notices to various coaching institutes for misleading advertisements and unfair trade practice. It has imposed a penalty of Rs 74.60 lakh on 23 coaching institutes and directed them to discontinue the misleading advertisements. (This story has not been edited by News18 staff and is published from a syndicated news agency feed - PTI ) tags : IAS UPSC Location : New Delhi, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 20:44 IST News india Consumer Protection Watchdog Fines Vision IAS Rs 3 Lakh For ‘Deceptive Advertising’ Read More

title: Independent MLA Blames Dual Power System For Mysterious Deaths In J&K’s Rajouri
summary: An independent MLA supporting the National Conference-led government blamed the dual power system for the mysterious death of 17 persons in Rajouri district.
full_content: Independent MLA Blames Dual Power System For Mysterious Deaths In J&K’s Rajouri Published By : Ronit Singh PTI Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 20:41 IST An independent MLA supporting the National Conference-led government blamed the dual power system for the mysterious death of 17 persons in Rajouri district. reset Follow us on Google News Rajouri residents raise the issue of mysterious illness affecting the inhabitants of Badhaal village | Image/X An independent MLA supporting the National Conference-led government in Jammu and Kashmir blamed the dual power system for the mysterious death of 17 persons, including 13 children, in a remote village in the Rajouri district. Former judge Muzaffar Iqbal Khan, who won the Assembly election from the Thanamandi constituency as an independent candidate after being denied a ticket by his party the National Conference (NC) following an agreement with its coalition partner Congress, urged for immediate restoration of statehood to end the ‘dual power’ system in the Union Territory. related stories Khan, along with NC leader and MLA Budhal Javaid Iqbal Choudhary and Congress MLA from Rajouri Iftkhar Ahmad, threatened to resign to protest “mishandling of the situation" in the Badhaal village, where 17 persons belonging to three families died due to mysterious illness between December 7 and January 19. “The press conference was held to express our disappointment and displeasure about this dual system, which is working here in Jammu and Kashmir and has to be stopped somewhere. It is telling upon not only the health, but also on the psyche of the people who voted en masse, elected their representative and are now getting disappointed," Khan told PTI in Rajouri. Asserting that it is not in the national interest to run the dual power system in Jammu and Kashmir, he said the Omar Abdullah government must be given full powers, otherwise there will be no end to such types of problems. “We want to send a message to the Union government, which has promised restoration of statehood to J-K in and outside Parliament. The prime minister is on record having assured restoration of statehood," he said. Quoting his conversations with the Budhal MLA, he alleged certain officers mishandled the situation with regard to the treatment of the patients but “you cannot fix the responsibility because you do not have a single control. “Certain officers are controlled by one authority and others by other authorities. In this type of system, it is the general public who is suffering," he said. Fear psychosis has gripped the population due to the mysterious deaths, he said, hoping that the mystery is resolved soon. Choudhary said there is an urgent need to address the loopholes in the system so that the people get some relief. “The GMC Rajouri is facing a shortage of 62 per cent staff, including doctors and paramedics. It has no MRI facility even as it is meant to cater to more than 14 lakh population," the MLA said. He alleged the air ambulance could not be arranged on time for the patients due to the dual power system, leading to so many deaths. “I knocked the door of all to ensure the best treatment for the patients but this bureaucratic setup proved the biggest hurdle as nobody listened to us," he said, claiming that an “anarchist situation" is presently prevailing in J&K and there is an immediate need to restore centralized power. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Meanwhile, GMC Rajouri Principal Amarjeet Singh Bhatia said there are 11 patients in the hospital, of which nine are in observation and two in ICU wards. “All the nine patients are recovering and responding to the treatment and the two patients admitted in ICU are also hemodynamically stable. The last patient admitted on Thursday was an 11-year-old girl and in the past 48 hours, we have not received any new patients," he said. (This story has not been edited by News18 staff and is published from a syndicated news agency feed - PTI ) tags : jammu and kashmir Location : Jammu and Kashmir, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 20:41 IST News india Independent MLA Blames Dual Power System For Mysterious Deaths In J&K’s Rajouri Read More

title: Maha Kumbh Has Only One Message, Of Unity And Integrity: Yogi Adityanath | Exclusive Interview
summary: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said the Maha Kumbh did not discriminate on the basis of caste, creed, sect or gender, and all were able to bathe in the Sangam in Prayagraj
full_content: Maha Kumbh Has Only One Message, Of Unity And Integrity: Yogi Adityanath | Exclusive Interview Curated By : News Desk News18.com Edited By: Oindrila Mukherjee Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 21:13 IST Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said the Maha Kumbh did not discriminate on the basis of caste, creed, sect or gender, and all were able to bathe in the Sangam in Prayagraj reset Follow us on Google News Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath in conversation with Network18 Group Editor-in-chief Rahul Joshi, at the Maha Kumbh 2025 in Prayagraj. (Image: News18) Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said the Maha Kumbh has only one message, that of unity and integrity. He said this message of unity will strengthen Sanatan Dharma and, in turn, the country. In an exclusive interview with Network18 Group Editor-in-chief Rahul Joshi, Adityanath spoke about the message of the Maha Kumbh that had attracted devotees and visitors alike from far and wide. He said the religious gathering did not discriminate on the basis of caste, creed, sect or gender, and all were able to bathe in the Sangam – the confluence of the Ganga, Yamuna and mythical Sarasvati – in Prayagraj. related stories “The Maha Kumbh propagates only one message. You must now be privy to it. There is no caste, creed, sect or gender discrimination. All people are able to bathe in the Sangam, there is no discrimination. The message of the Maha Kumbh is the message of unity and integrity, and this should go out into the world," he said. He added: “If all the saints, devotees or even tourists, who are part of the Maha Kumbh, take forward the message of unity, then Sanatan Dharma will be strengthened and, if Sanatan Dharma is strong, then our country will be stronger." He said Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s vision has made the kumbh mela synonymous with cleanliness and security. It can be attributed to his leadership, and the arrangements are a prime example of how such events can be organised in a grand manner with the touch of the divine. ALSO READ | Exclusive: PM Modi Saw, Showed The Power Of Spiritual Tourism: UP CM Yogi Adityanath On Maha Kumbh ‘CONFLUENCE OF MODERNITY AND SPIRITUALITY’ Adityanath said the confluence of modernity and spirituality in the Maha Kumbh is a major attraction for the youth and global tourists. He said while previous governments projected the event as being for senior citizens, they did not provide facilities for that. But, he said, the scenario is different now and the kumbh mela is no longer tied to “filth, stampede, and chaos". “As you can see for the first time, in 2019 as well as in 2025, it is the result of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s vision that the kumbh mela can now be tied to cleanliness and security. And it is because of the grand arrangements, there is a confluence of modernity and spirituality. Hence, it is obvious that the youth will be a part of this," he added. The UP chief minister said not only Hindus, but also non-Hindus have taken a dip in the Sangam and are full of praise for the kumbh mela. He said it is his good fortune to be organising the kumbh mela exactly a year after the Ram temple was inaugurated in Ayodhya. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all ALSO READ | Exclusive: ‘Those Roaming Around With Constitution…’ Adityanath Slams INDIA Bloc’s ‘Foreign-Funded Propaganda’ “January 2024 ended a wait of 500 years with the establishment of the Ram temple. Ram Lalla is now in his rightful abode. I was present there as a sevak and also had the good fortune of organising the kumbh… This new success story that Uttar Pradesh is writing is all because of the visionary leadership of the prime minister," he added. tags : Hinduism kumbh mela Sanatan Dharma spirituality Yogi Adityanath Location : Prayagraj, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 20:34 IST News india Maha Kumbh Has Only One Message, Of Unity And Integrity: Yogi Adityanath | Exclusive Interview Read More
