title: Kangana Ranaut Begins Shooting For Next Film With R Madhavan; Is It For Tanu Weds Manu 3?
summary: Kangana Ranaut, who was last seen in Emergency, has shared a picture from the set of her next film with Tanu Weds Manu co-star R Madhavan.
full_content: Kangana Ranaut Begins Shooting For Next Film With R Madhavan; Is It For Tanu Weds Manu 3? Curated By : Lubna Khan News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 14:48 IST Kangana Ranaut, who was last seen in Emergency, has shared a picture from the set of her next film with Tanu Weds Manu co-star R Madhavan. reset Follow us on Google News Kangana Ranaut has shared a picture from the set of her next film with Tanu Weds Manu co-star R Madhavan. Kangana Ranaut has already begun working on her next project! The actress, who was recently seen in ‘Emergency’, shared a picture from the set of her next film with Tanu Weds Manu co-star R Madhavan. While fans were quick to speculate that Kangana and R Madhavan were teaming up for Tanu Weds Manu 3, it turns out that’s not the case! They are teaming up for another project, an upcoming pan-India psychological thriller film, which the actress had announced in 2023. Kangana Ranaut took to her Instagram story to share a picture from the set of her upcoming film with R Madhavan. The picture features a clapperboard of the untitled film, and it reads, “Date Jan 25, Day… Scene No: 25… Shot 10… Take 1." Madhavan and Kangana’s names are on it, with some additional details about the film. “Production No: 18. A film by Vijay produced by R. Ravindran. DOP: Nirav Shah." The film is not Tanu Weds Manu 3, but actually a pan-India psychological thriller film that Kangana had announced two years ago. The yet-untitled film is helmed by the Thalaivii director Vijay. “Nothing is more delightful than being on a film set," wrote the actress. Check out her Instagram story below! related stories Kangana Ranaut’s Instagram story In 2023, Kangana Ranaut had shared a post on X (previously Twitter), announcing that the production of this film had begun in Chennai. “Today in Chennai we started filming our new film, a psychological thriller. Other details coming soon. For now need all your support and blessings for this very unusual and exciting script," she wrote. When Kangana Ranaut Expressed Her Excitement About Working With Vijay Again Back then, she also expressed her excitement about teaming up with Vijay once again, and wrote, “Dear Vijay sir after the incredible experience of Thalaivii happy to be basking in your glory again I love to be your team and take your commands. Thank you sir." The music for the film is composed by GV Prakash Kumar. The film will reportedly have a bilingual release, in Hindi and Tamil. Meanwhile, in February last year, Kangana had also shared a selfie with R Madhavan. She called him her favourite co-star, and wrote, “back with my fav @actormaddy for another stunning script." Madhavan and Kangana previously shared screen space in Tanu Weds Manu and Tanu Weds Manu Returns. R Madhavan Says No One Approached Him For Tanu Weds Manu 3 Meanwhile, recently, in an interview with Indian Express, Madhavan was asked about Tanu Weds Manu 3 with Kangana Ranaut. He said that he had not heard any scripts and hinted that he might have been replaced in the film. “As much as I would like to talk about it, I really have no idea. It has just been on Instagram," he said. “The media and people are asking me these questions. Neither Anand nor anybody else has talked to me about part three. I have no clue and I don’t know what the script is. Maybe I am not there in it. Maybe they have replaced me. I haven’t got the faintest idea," he added. tags : bollywood Kangana Ranaut R Madhavan Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 14:44 IST News movies Kangana Ranaut Begins Shooting For Next Film With R Madhavan; Is It For Tanu Weds Manu 3? title: Watch: Timothee Chalamet Talks Playing Bob Dylan And His ‘Little Stache’ On SNL
summary: Timothee Chalamet didn’t just come to deliver comedy, he also brought his musical talents as the night’s guest performer.
full_content: Watch: Timothee Chalamet Talks Playing Bob Dylan And His ‘Little Stache’ On SNL Published By : Chirag Sehgal Trending Desk Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 14:34 IST Timothee Chalamet didn’t just come to deliver comedy, he also brought his musical talents as the night’s guest performer. reset Follow us on Google News Timothee kicked off his monologue with a healthy dose of self-deprecating humour. (Photo Credits: Instagram) Timothee Chalamet took to the Saturday Night Live stage on January 25 with a playful energy that had the audience laughing from the get-go. For his third time hosting the iconic show, the 29-year-old actor didn’t just come to deliver comedy, he also brought his musical talents as the night’s guest performer. And true to his style, he kicked off his monologue with a healthy dose of self-deprecating humour and a bit of cheeky commentary on his recent career journey. “Hosting SNL again is great, but this time, I’ve got something new, a little moustache and a goatee!" Chalamet said with a smile, making light of his appearance and a joke he’d made earlier at the Golden Globes. “37 hairs right here," he said, pointing to his goatee as the camera zoomed in for effect, drawing a laugh from the crowd. related stories The actor, fresh off his portrayal of Willy Wonka in Wonka, also took a moment to reflect on his latest role as the legendary Bob Dylan in A Complete Unknown. “Playing Bob Dylan right after Willy Wonka? Yeah, that was a little strange," he admitted. “But you know what? I found out they have a lot in common. They’re both eccentric, innovative and let’s not forget, both enslaved hundreds of Oompa-Loompas," he added. Chalamet, never one to shy away from poking fun at himself, segued into a hilarious segment about his ongoing streak of losses at major award shows. After all, A Complete Unknown has earned eight Oscar nominations, including Best Picture, yet the actor continues to face defeat with grace and wit. “It’s such an honour to go to these award shows," Chalamet began his tone half-serious and half-joking. “But let’s be real, I keep losing. And every time it happens, it gets a little harder to act like it doesn’t sting." With that, he rolled a montage of his defeated, and often humorous, reactions to his loss at previous ceremonies. “Oh look, another lonely night with my Dune popcorn bucket," he laughed as one particularly painful loss was displayed. Not one to dwell on disappointment, Chalamet quickly turned things around by pretending to practice an acceptance speech, until the scene was hilariously interrupted by SNL cast member Kenan Thompson, who grabbed the mock trophy and delivered a comedic take of his own. Before leaving the stage, Chalamet gave a sneak peek into his musical segment, teasing his performances of Bob Dylan songs. “You might not know the songs I’m going to perform, but trust me, they’re my personal favourites," he shared. “And I’m just so thankful that SNL is still doing weird stuff like this 50 years in. Honestly, they’re either really kind to let me do this… or this is a prank, and I’ll find out later. I can’t tell," he added. Following an introduction by former SNL star Adam Sandler, Chalamet launched into a high-energy rendition of Dylan’s Outlaw Blues. The performance effortlessly transitioned into a more intimate, spoken-word version of Three Angels, with surprise guest James Blake joining him on keyboards and vocals. Chalamet rounded out his musical set with a heartfelt cover of Tomorrow Is a Long Time, proving that he’s not just a charming host, but a talented musician with a deep connection to the music he’s performing, reports Billboard. tags : entertainment hollywood Timothee Chalamet Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 14:28 IST News movies Watch: Timothee Chalamet Talks Playing Bob Dylan And His ‘Little Stache’ On SNL Read More

title: Bigg Boss Kannada 11: Hanumantha Lamani Creates History, Becomes 1st Wildcard Contestant To Win

full_content: Bigg Boss Kannada 11: Hanumantha Lamani Creates History, Becomes 1st Wildcard Contestant To Win Curated By : Grace Cyril News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 14:12 IST Hanumantha Lamani defeated Trivikram in the finale and won a cash prize of Rs 50 lakh. reset Follow us on Google News Hanumantha emerges as winner of Kichcha Sudeep-hosted show. title: Twinkle Khanna Says She's 'Blamed' For Akshay Kumar's Political Views: 'People Believe He Isn't My Husband...'
summary: Twinkle Khanna said Akshay Kumar is not a toddler who will listen to everything she says.
full_content: Twinkle Khanna Says She's 'Blamed' For Akshay Kumar's Political Views: 'People Believe He Isn't My Husband...' Curated By : Kashvi Raj Singh News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 14:06 IST Twinkle Khanna said Akshay Kumar is not a toddler who will listen to everything she says. reset Follow us on Google News Akshay Kumar and Twinkle Khanna. Akshay Kumar and Twinkle Khanna tied the knot in 2001 and have been married for nearly 24 years now. The couple has two children, a son named Aarav and a daughter named Nitara. However, the two have very different ideologies and barely have commonalities. They have often addressed how they have differing political views and in her latest column for the Times of India, Twinkle mentioned how she is often blamed for them having contrasting ideologies. Twinkle Khanna wrote, “Sitting  for an interview, I am asked, ‘You are a star wife; tell us what it’s like?’ While my first instinct is to bite the reporter’s index finger, I reply, ‘I am not sure that an entity like ‘star wife’ exists, unless, in the way that Manglik women marry trees, because of some Rahu Ketu ka dosh, you end up marrying Sirius or worse, Halley’s Comet.’" related stories She added, “After 20 years of answering this annoying question, I have an oyster-like attitude to irritants and the ability to craft black pearls of wisdom in response. I’m also often asked about — and blamed for — the difference in our political views. It’s almost like people believe he isn’t my husband but a toddler who will listen to me when I say, ‘Beta ji, please walk on the left side of the road, and I will give you a Frooti.’" In a previous interview with Galatta India, Akshay Kumar also spoke about the differences between him and Twinkle. Akshay said, “Me and my wife are very different. We are poles apart. She thinks left, I think right. The only thing which is common in us is that we both like to sleep early and wake up early. Another thing which we like is playing Rummy or Ludo. Nothing else is common in us. But, it’s not just about that. Respect is the most important thing. It is important to give each other space. There are 36 traits in people, not necessarily they all have to be common in a couple. But if you have that one trait of respecting each other, I think it’s equivalent to having all the traits you need in a relationship." Meanwhile, on the work front, Akshay Kumar is currently seen in Sky Force. The film marks Veer Pahariya’s debut and also stars Sara Ali Khan. tags : Akshay Kumar bollywood Twinkle Khanna Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 14:06 IST News movies Twinkle Khanna Says She's 'Blamed' For Akshay Kumar's Political Views: 'People Believe He Isn't My Husband...' title: Sky Force Box Office Collection Day 3: Akshay Kumar And Veer Pahariya’s Film Soars With Rs 61 Crore Opening Weekend
summary: Sky Force Box Office Collection Report Day 3: After a modest start, Akshay Kumar and Veer Pahariya’s Sky Force soared high over its opening weekend, raking in ₹61.75 crore domestically and showing a remarkable 80% growth on Saturday.
full_content: Sky Force Box Office Collection Day 3: Akshay Kumar And Veer Pahariya’s Film Soars With Rs 61 Crore Opening Weekend Curated By : Yatamanyu Narain News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 14:36 IST Sky Force Box Office Collection Report Day 3: After a modest start, Akshay Kumar and Veer Pahariya’s Sky Force soared high over its opening weekend, raking in ₹61.75 crore domestically and showing a remarkable 80% growth on Saturday. reset Follow us on Google News Akshay Kumar and Veer Pahariya’s Sky Force shows impressive growth over its opening weekend, earning ₹61.75 crore in 3 days. Sky Force Box Office Collection Report Day 3: After a modest start, Akshay Kumar and debutant Veer Pahariya’s Sky Force took off with impressive momentum over its opening weekend. The aerial action film showed remarkable growth on Saturday and sustained it on Sunday, closing its first weekend on a high note. If it can clear the crucial Monday test, the film could be headed for a solid lifetime run. Sky Force earned ₹12.25 crore on its opening day, slightly underwhelming for a project of its scale. However, the film bounced back with an 80% surge on Saturday, collecting ₹22 crore. On Sunday, it added another ₹27.50 crore, bringing its domestic nett total to ₹61.75 crore. According to Sacnilk, the producers suggest the opening weekend collection might touch ₹70 crore. related stories The film has also performed decently overseas, earning $600K (₹5 crore) in its first two days, although the bulk of its earnings is expected to come from the Indian market, a hallmark of Akshay Kumar’s films. Positive word-of-mouth and strong reviews have fueled Sky Force’s growth. The crucial Monday collections will determine whether the film can maintain its momentum and secure a robust first-week haul. Directed by Abhishek Anil Kapur and Sandeep Kewlani, Sky Force draws inspiration from the Indo-Pakistani air war of 1965, focusing on the Sargodha airbase attack in Pakistan. The film stars Akshay Kumar, Veer Pahariya, Sara Ali Khan, and Sharad Kelkar, with a special cameo by Nimrat Kaur. News18 Showsha review of the film reads, “At 2 hours 5 minutes, Sky Force makes for a crisp and taut screenplay that rarely drops pace. Kudos to the director duo, who seamlessly blend in their individual instincts and style, never once making you wonder that there are two captains sailing the ship! The film is bereft of melodramatic dialogues about desh bhakti or contrived sequences aimed to evoke sappy sentimentality. The makers manage to strike a fine balance between realism and cinematic flamboyance and they deserve brownie points for the same." It further stated, “The aerial saga is a true Republic Day treat and it deserves a watch for its execution and treatment. It packs a punch without trying too hard and sets a precedent for a modern-day patriotic film where friendship and loyalty take a precedence over politics and ultra-nationalism." tags : Akshay Kumar bollywood veer pahariya Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 14:05 IST News movies Sky Force Box Office Collection Day 3: Akshay Kumar And Veer Pahariya’s Film Soars With Rs 61 Crore Opening Weekend Read More

full_content: Lakshmi Manchu Claims IndiGo Airlines ‘Harassed’ Her During Bag Check: 'Felt Violated' Curated By : Grace Cyril News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 13:51 IST IndiGo Airlines has also responded to Lakshmi Manchu's complaint. reset Follow us on Google News Lakshmi Manchu has slammed an airline for damaged baggage. Actress Lakshmi Manchu has accused IndiGo Airlines of harassing her during a recent bag check at the airport. In a social media post, Manchu detailed her experience, describing how the staff conducted an invasive bag check and treated her in a manner she deemed disrespectful. In multiple tweets, Lakshmi called out the staff for being ‘rude’. Manchu was reportedly travelling on a domestic flight with the airline when she was stopped for a routine security check. According to her account, the airline’s ground staff demanded to inspect her luggage in an overly aggressive manner. title: Taba Chake Reveals He Almost Quit Music After Bombay Dreams: 'This Was Meant To Be My Last Album' | Exclusive
summary: After nearly quitting music, Taba Chake’s Bombay Dreams became a phenomenon with over 12.2 million streams, redefining India’s indie scene. Ahead of Ziro On Tour, he reflects on his journey, the struggles behind his breakout album, and his commitment to authenticity.
full_content: Taba Chake Reveals He Almost Quit Music After Bombay Dreams: 'This Was Meant To Be My Last Album' | Exclusive Reported By : Yatamanyu Narain News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 13:50 IST After nearly quitting music, Taba Chake’s Bombay Dreams became a phenomenon with over 12.2 million streams, redefining India’s indie scene. Ahead of Ziro On Tour, he reflects on his journey, the struggles behind his breakout album, and his commitment to authenticity. reset Follow us on Google News From nearly quitting music to creating the phenomenon Bombay Dreams with over 12.2 million streams, Taba Chake redefined India’s indie scene. Hailing from the picturesque village of Rono in Arunachal Pradesh, Taba Chake is not your average singer-songwriter. Armed with a guitar, a deep connection to nature, and a knack for weaving multilingual magic, he’s the Nyishi fingerstyle guitarist who’s taking India’s indie scene by storm. Fluent in Nyishi, Hindi, English, Nepali, and Assamese, Taba crafts songs that transcend boundaries—both linguistic and emotional—making him one of the most authentic voices in Indian music today. Starting his musical journey at six and penning his first songs by eleven, Taba’s story is as enchanting as his melodies. His debut EP, Bond with Nature (2016), gave listeners a glimpse into his world—a unique blend of tribal folklore and contemporary sounds. But it was his 2019 album, Bombay Dreams, that truly showcased his genius. With tracks like Meri Dastaan and This is the Day—both years in the making—Taba’s dedication to storytelling and soulful melodies was unmistakable. related stories Taba’s music isn’t just about sounds; it’s a love letter to his roots. Drawing inspiration from the lush landscapes of Arunachal Pradesh, birdsong, and tribal folklore, his percussive guitar playing and heartfelt vocals transport listeners to another world. Whether at the iconic Ziro Festival of Music or onstage at Ragasthan, Taba has made waves across India, leaving audiences captivated. In 2024, Taba made a surprising leap into Bollywood, composing music for Shoojit Sircar’s I Want To Talk, starring Abhishek Bachchan. While he still calls indie music his home, this milestone showed his ability to blend his unique style into mainstream cinema, further broadening his artistic horizons. Now, Taba Chake is ready to charm Hyderabad at the Ziro On Tour festival, a first-of-its-kind initiative by Signature Packaged Drinking Water and Ziro Festival of Music. Taking the magic of India’s most eco-friendly music festival beyond Arunachal Pradesh, Ziro On Tour is set to dazzle audiences at the historic Taramati Baradari on February 1st and 2nd, 2025. With its blend of music, sustainability, and cultural immersion, this event promises to raise a toast to community spirit and mindful living. In an exclusive conversation with News18 Showsha, Taba opened up about his musical journey, the years it took to craft Bombay Dreams, and how he almost gave up on music—only to come back stronger. From visualizing his songs to preparing for his performance at Ziro On Tour, Taba Chake’s story is proof that music, when rooted in authenticity, has the power to bridge worlds and touch hearts. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Taba Chake (@taba.chake) Here are the excerpts: Let’s start with the Ziro Festival of Music. What are your thoughts on the idea of taking it beyond Arunachal Pradesh to a city like Hyderabad? Do you think it could connect with a whole new audience? Absolutely, I have no doubt about it. Music transcends boundaries—it’s something that resonates with everyone, no matter the place or language. A city like Hyderabad has such a vibrant and diverse crowd, so bringing the Ziro Festival there would definitely open it up to a whole new audience. I believe this could be a massive hit. If the organizers decide to expand and make the Ziro Tour a regular thing, I’m sure it would continue to grow in popularity year after year. It’s all about sharing that incredible energy and spirit of the festival with more people, and I think Hyderabad is the perfect place to start. Signature Packaged Drinking Water is supporting sustainability at Ziro On Tour. As an artist and storyteller, how do you feel about sustainability being woven into the festival’s narrative? I think it’s an incredible initiative. As an artist, sustainability resonates deeply with me because it aligns with the stories I want to tell and the legacy I hope to leave behind. I often tell my team that when we’re planning something—whether it’s a tour or a project—we strive to think beyond the usual. We want something unique, something meaningful, and most importantly, something green. It’s important for us to incorporate recycled and sustainable elements, not just for the sake of doing it but because it reflects where I come from and the values embedded in my music. What Ziro Festival is doing—tying sustainability into its core narrative—is truly inspiring. I know it’s ...

title: Tamil Director Mysskin Claims He Was 'Threatened' To Sell TV Rights Of His Film: 'Made Me Sign The Deal'
summary: Director Mysskin claims he was threatened into selling the television rights of his hit film ‘Onnayum Aattukkuttiyum’ for Rs 75 lakh.
full_content: Tamil Director Mysskin Claims He Was 'Threatened' To Sell TV Rights Of His Film: 'Made Me Sign The Deal' Published By : Chirag Sehgal IANS Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 13:41 IST Director Mysskin claims he was threatened into selling the television rights of his hit film ‘Onnayum Aattukkuttiyum’ for Rs 75 lakh. reset Follow us on Google News Tamil director Mysskin makes big claims during a recent event. One of Tamil cinema’s top directors Mysskin has now alleged that he was threatened into selling the television rights of his hit film ‘Onnayum Aattukkuttiyum’ for a meagre Rs 75 lakhs. Participating in the trailer launch event of ‘Bad Girl’, Mysskin, who spoke on a number of topics, apologized for some of his statements made at an earlier event. He then said, “I did ‘Onnayum Aattukkuttiyum’. They did not allow me to release it the first day. People do not know. The next day, it released in the night." related stories The director then said that ten days after the film released, some people came to buy its television rights. “At that point, a big director close to me told me that he would get me a huge sum of money for that film and took me to a place. We went into a large room. There were 20 people in that room. ‘Give the television rights of this film to us for 75 lakhs,’ they said. I told them, ‘Sir, I have made this film with great difficulty. This is a good film. Please give me at least Rs Two crore for its television rights. They kept saying they wouldn’t be able to give me that money," Mysskin said. “It was then that I realized that they had 20 goondas, who threatened me and made me sign (the deal). They gave me Rs 75 lakhs. That film has been released on that channel 80 times. I took that cheque, tore it before them and said, ‘When I came to Chennai, I had only a white paper and a pencil. I come from such a poor family.’ I told them that ‘I will definitely make a comeback with my hardwork’, " Mysskin recalled. The director and actor went on to say, “Four of those who were there then have passed away. The man who betrayed me, he is a big director. He is there even today. I keep experiencing betrayals every moment." (This story has not been edited by News18 staff and is published from a syndicated news agency feed - IANS ) tags : Mysskin regional cinema Location : Chennai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 13:41 IST News movies Tamil Director Mysskin Claims He Was 'Threatened' To Sell TV Rights Of His Film: 'Made Me Sign The Deal' Read More

title: Coldplay Beats Diljit Dosanjh, Justin Beiber As 1.34 Lakh Fans Attend Mega Ahmedabad Concert
summary: Coldplay's Ahmedabad concert was India's largest concert ever with 1.34 lakh people attending it!
full_content: Coldplay Beats Diljit Dosanjh, Justin Beiber As 1.34 Lakh Fans Attend Mega Ahmedabad Concert Curated By : Grace Cyril Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 12:26 IST Coldplay's Ahmedabad concert was India's largest concert ever with 1.34 lakh people attending it! reset Follow us on Google News Coldplay Ahmedabad goes big! Move over, Bieber – Coldplay just rewrote the rulebook for concerts in India! The British rock legends lit up Ahmedabad on Republic Day (January 26, 2035) like never before, pulling off the biggest concert in the country’s history. That’s right, the “Beliebers" are going to have to sit this one out because Coldplay’s Ahmedabad stop smashed the attendance record. Coldplay held a total of five gigs in Mumbai and Ahmedabad. On Monday, January 27, the band shared on X (formerly Twitter) that their final concert in Ahmedabad saw 1,34,000 people in attendance live. With this, Coldplay becomes the largest ticketed concert in India ever. Before this, this title was held by singers Diljit Dosanjh and Justin Bieber, with 50,000 people in attendance. related stories With a crowd so massive it could probably be seen from space, the band turned Narendra Modi Stadium into a galaxy of lights (and loud cheers). Fans sang along to every hit, from Fix You to Viva La Vida, waving their glowing wristbands and screaming their lungs out. Chris Martin-led Coldplay performed five shows in India as part of their Music of the Spheres World Tour. The first three gigs were in Mumbai followed by two shows in Ahmedabad. Interestingly, this is the biggest concert ever for Coldplay as well. It surpassed the 83,000 mark from their Sydney gig in November last year. It should be noted that the Narendra Modi Stadium is a cricket ground with a seating capacity of over a lakh in the stands alone. Apart from that, there were fans on the ground as well which made the band have an audience of about 1.4 lakh for the concert. Meanwhile, both Diljit Dosanjh and Justin Bieber had performed in much smaller stadiums. The latter’s gig was held at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai in 2017. On the other hand, Diljit had 50,000 people attending his concert at Sector 34 Ground in Chandigarh in December 2024 as part of the Dil-Luminati Tour. tags : Chris Martin Coldplay hollywood Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 12:26 IST News movies Coldplay Beats Diljit Dosanjh, Justin Beiber As 1.34 Lakh Fans Attend Mega Ahmedabad Concert Read More

title: Chhaava Director Meets Raj Thackeray, Assures 'Objectionable' Scenes Will Be Removed
summary: This comes a day after Maharashtra minister Uday Samant expressed disappointment with Vicky Kaushal’s upcoming movie.
full_content: Chhaava Director Meets Raj Thackeray, Assures 'Objectionable' Scenes Will Be Removed Curated By : Chirag Sehgal News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 12:18 IST This comes a day after Maharashtra minister Uday Samant expressed disappointment with Vicky Kaushal’s upcoming movie. reset Follow us on Google News Vicky Kaushal's Chhaava is directed by Laxman Uttekar. Filmmaker Laxman Uttekar met Maharashtra Navnirman Sena leader Raj Thackeray amid the controversies regarding his upcoming film, Chhaava. Following his meeting with the politician, the director spoke to the media and assured that all objectionable scenes from the Vicky Kaushal starrer will be removed before its release. Chhaava director clarified that with the upcoming movie, their intention is not to hurt anyone’s sentiments. He also revealed that the scenes in the movie where Vicky Kaushal is seen playing Lezim (a folk dance from Maharashtra and a musical instrument) will also be removed. related stories This comes a day after Maharashtra minister Uday Samant expressed disappointment with Vicky Kaushal’s upcoming movie. He raised objections to a scene where Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj is shown dancing and said that it should be removed. “If they raise objections, we will not let it be released," Samant said while speaking to the media and then threatened the block the film’s release. “The movie shows Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj dancing. The director should cut this part. This movie should be shown to historians and scholars. If they raise objections, we will not let it be released," he added. Prior to Samant, in an interaction with PTI, Sambhajiraje Chhatrapati, a descendant of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and former Rajya Sabha MP, also expressed his desire to watch the full film before its release. “I also offered to connect them with historians to address inaccuracies to ensure this significant story is presented authentically to audiences worldwide," he said. Chhaava is a historical drama that revolves around the life of Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, the son of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. In the film, Vicky Kaushal is set to portray the character of Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, the eldest son of the Maratha empire’s founder. The film also stars Rashmika Mandanna, Akshaye Khanna, Ashutosh Rana, and Divya Dutta in key roles. Chhaava will hit theatres on February 14, 2025. title: Sunny Deol Wishes ‘Lord’ Bobby Deol With Endearing Post On His Birthday, Esha Deol Showers Love
summary: Bobby Deol is celebrating his 56th birthday today, and here’s how Sunny Deol wished his little brother.
full_content: Sunny Deol Wishes ‘Lord’ Bobby Deol With Endearing Post On His Birthday, Esha Deol Showers Love Curated By : Lubna Khan News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 12:10 IST Bobby Deol is celebrating his 56th birthday today, and here’s how Sunny Deol wished his little brother. reset Follow us on Google News Here's how Sunny Deol wished his 'little brother' Bobby Deol. Bollywood actor Bobby Deol turned a year older today. The ‘Animal’ actor is celebrating his 56 th birthday, and wishes for the actor started flooding on social media right from midnight. Bobby Deol’s elder brother and actor Sunny Deol made his day extra-special by sharing an endearing post for him on social media. He extended birthday wishes to his ‘Lord Bobby’, and shared a lovely picture with him. Meanwhile, their sister Esha Deol also showered love! Sunny Deol took to his Instagram account on Monday morning to share a photo of him hugging his brother Bobby Deol. The Gadar actor is all smiles as he embraces his brother, and their strong brotherly bond and camaraderie are quite evident in the photo. In his caption, Sunny addressed him as ‘Lord Bobby’, a name affectionately adopted by the latter’s fans. “Happy Birthday Little Brother My Lord Bobby," wrote Sunny, along with several red heart emojis. Esha Deol was among the first ones to comment on the post, and she also dropped red heart emojis on the post. Rahul Dev also commented on the post, wishing Bobby a happy birthday. Check it out below! related stories View this post on Instagram A post shared by Sunny Deol (@iamsunnydeol) Sunny Deol’s son Karan Deol also shared a picture with his uncle Bobby Deol on Instagram. Wishing him, he wrote, “Happy Birthday Bobby Chacha, Lots of love." Bobby Deol, who was seen in Sandeep Reddy Vanga’s 2023 film ‘Animal’ was lauded for his role as the antagonist in the film starring Ranbir Kapoor. After ‘Animal’, he was seen in Siva’s 2024 film ‘Kanguva’, starring Suriya. The film also stars Disha Patani, Yogi Babu, Natty Subramaniam, among others. He recently made his debut in the Telugu film industry with his remarkable performance in Bobby Kolli’s ‘Daaku Maharaaj’ starring Nandumuri Balakrishna and Urvashi Rautela. Next up, he will be seen in Thalapathy Vijay starrer ‘ Jana Nayagan ’. Bobby Deol is also set to play villain in Saif Ali Khan and Priyadarshan’s next thriller. tags : Bobby Deol bollywood Esha Deol Sunny Deol Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 12:10 IST News movies Sunny Deol Wishes ‘Lord’ Bobby Deol With Endearing Post On His Birthday, Esha Deol Showers Love Read More

title: Ali Fazal Was Denied Paternity Leave After Daughter's Birth, Reveals Richa Chadha
summary: Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal welcomed their first child, a baby girl, last year.
full_content: Ali Fazal Was Denied Paternity Leave After Daughter's Birth, Reveals Richa Chadha Curated By : Grace Cyril News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 11:49 IST Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal welcomed their first child, a baby girl, last year. reset Follow us on Google News Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal welcomed a baby girl last year. Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal are enjoying the new phase of parenthood. The couple welcomed their baby girl, Zuneyra Ida Fazal, in July 2024. In a new interview, Richa opened up about the early months of motherhood and how Ali was denied paternity leave. She said that it always helps to have one’s partner at home to help when a new baby is born. In an interview with Faye D’Souza on her YouTube channel, Richa said that Ali Fazal had asked for paternity leave after the birth of their daughter. However, he did not get it. She also revealed that it was a miracle that his shoot had got postponed. related stories Richa shared, “Ali asked for paternity leave after we had our baby, and he did not really get it. Everyone was like, ‘Haha, really you want? Okay, one two weeks is fine.’ It was a miracle his shoot got pushed for some other reason, but he was able to be with me, and I can’t explain how terrifying it can be for a new person." She went on to add, “You are dealing with all kinds of emotions, there is no sleep, all kinds of aches and pain and so much brain fog… It is so helpful to have a partner around you. Not everyone can afford amazing childcare in our country." Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal first met and fell in love on the sets of Fukrey. The couple had announced their wedding in September 2022 and they tied the knot in Lucknow on October 4 that year. In 2024, the couple shared a glimpse of their daughter on Instagram in a joint post and captioned it, “Doing a collab post to announce the biggest collab of our lives!! We’ve been blessed indeed. Our baby girl continues to keep us very, very busy. So Thank you all for your love and blessings." On the work front, Richa Chadha was last seen in Sanjay Leela Bhansali’s web series Heeramandi: The Diamond Bazaar. Meanwhile, Ali was last seen in Mirzapur 3. tags : Ali Fazal bollywood Richa Chadha Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 11:49 IST News movies Ali Fazal Was Denied Paternity Leave After Daughter's Birth, Reveals Richa Chadha Read More

full_content: Watch: Ektaa Kapoor's Birthday Wish For Son Ravie Came Gift-wrapped Like This Published By : Lubna Khan Trending Desk Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 11:46 IST On the special occasion, Ektaa Kapoor shared a Reel featuring herself and Ravie. reset Follow us on Google News Happy birthday, Ravie. (Photo Credits: Instagram) Ektaa Kapoor, one of the most successful producers in the entertainment industry, is a proud single mother to her 6-year-old son Ravie. She welcomed her son via surrogacy in 2019 and is celebrating his birthday today, January 27. On the special occasion, Ektaa Kapoor shared a Reel featuring herself and Ravie. Along with the video, Ektaa Kapoor wrote, “Jai hanumantaaa! May you be joyous happy and full of love, my darling son! You are the love of my life !" Ektaa’s fans and industry friends have shared the warmest greetings in the comments section. Arjun Bijlani dropped red hearts. Arslan Goni wrote, “Happy happy birthday to Ravie." Bhavana Pandey said, “Happy Birthday Ravie !!! Lots of love." Sophie Choudry too dropped a cute note for the little one. It read, “Happy bday Ravie ! God bless." Sonalie Bendra said, “Happy birthday. She said, “I had many people who were advising us. I also talked to my child. I told my 7-month-old child that you do not have a father, and I am learning with you. Meanwhile, Ektaa Kapoor’s The Sabarmati Report was successful at the box office. The film starred Vikrant Massey, Raashii Khanna and Ridhi Dogra. The Sabarmati Report provided an insight into the socio-political events around the 2002 Godhra riots. The film was directed by Ranjan Chandel. Ektaa Kapoor’s next project is Bhoot Bangla, a horror-comedy starring Akshay Kumar. For those who do not know, Ektaa Kapoor started her career in television at the age of 17 as an intern with feature filmmaker, Kailash Surendranath. She then went on to produce several hit daily soaps including Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi, Kahaani Ghar Ghar Ki, Kaahin Kissii Roz, Kasautii Zindagii Kay, Pavitra Rishta, and Bade Acche Lagte Hain. tags : Ektaa Kapoor entertainment films Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 11:46 IST News movies Watch: Ektaa Kapoor's Birthday Wish For Son Ravie Came Gift-wrapped Like This Read More

title: Sonu Nigam Disappointed As Alka Yagnik, Shreya Ghoshal Not Honoured With Padma Awards: ‘Kuch Nahi Mila’
summary: Sonu Nigam also was conferred with the Padma Shri by former President Ram Nath Kovind in 2022.
full_content: Sonu Nigam Disappointed As Alka Yagnik, Shreya Ghoshal Not Honoured With Padma Awards: ‘Kuch Nahi Mila’ Curated By : Chirag Sehgal News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 11:45 IST Sonu Nigam also was conferred with the Padma Shri by former President Ram Nath Kovind in 2022. reset Follow us on Google News Sonu Nigam says Alka Yagnik and Shreya Ghoshal must also be honoured for their talents. Sonu Nigam has expressed disappointment as singers like Alka Yagnik, Shreya Ghoshal, Sunidhi Chauhan and Kishore Kumar have not been honoured with Padma awards as of now. Recently, the singer took to his Instagram handle and shared a video in which he questioned the decision of not honouring these singers with Padma awards. He mentioned that these singers are an inspiration to all and therefore, their talents must be recognised. “Do aese singers hai jinhone poore duniya ke singers ko inspire kiya hai. Ek ko toh humne Padma Shri pe hi simtaa diya hai, woh hai Mohammed Rafi sahab. Aur ek hai jinko Padma Shri bhi naseeb nahi hua hai, Kishore Kumar ji. Posthumously award mil rahe hai na (There are two singers who have inspired singers all over the world. We have limited one of them with the Padma Shri award, that’s Mohammad Rafi. The other one didn’t even get a Padma Shri, Kishore Kumar. Awards are being given posthumously, right)?" Sonu said. related stories View this post on Instagram A post shared by Sonu Nigam (@sonunigamofficial) “Aur jo hai bhi unme se Alka Yagnik ji, itna lamba aur kamaal ka career raha hai, unhe kuch nahi mila abhi tak. Shreya Ghoshal, bohut samay se apni kala ka loha banwa rahi hai. Unko bhi milna chahiye. Sunidhi Chauhan, unhone bhi ek poore generation ko inpire kiya hai apni alag si awaaz se. Unhe bhi kuch nahi mila abhi tak (Among the current singers, Alka Yagnik had such a long and phenomenal career, she hasn’t received anything yet. Shreya Ghoshal has been proving her brilliance for a long time. She should also be honoured. Sunidhi Chauhan has inspired an entire generation with her unique voice. She also hasn’t received anything yet)," the singer added. In the caption of his video, Sonu wrote, “India and it’s pending Padma Awardees." Meanwhile, Sonu Nigam was conferred with the Padma Shri by former President Ram Nath Kovind in 2022. tags : Alka Yagnik bollywood Shreya Ghoshal Sonu Nigam Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 11:45 IST News movies Sonu Nigam Disappointed As Alka Yagnik, Shreya Ghoshal Not Honoured With Padma Awards: ‘Kuch Nahi Mila’ Read More

title: Chris Martin’s Dad Anthony Martin Proudly Records His Son’s Performance At Coldplay Ahmedabad Concert | Video
summary: Chris Martin’s father Anthony Martin was spotted at Narendra Modi Stadium, enjoying Coldplay’s performance during their concert in Ahmedabad.
full_content: Chris Martin’s Dad Anthony Martin Proudly Records His Son’s Performance At Coldplay Ahmedabad Concert | Video Curated By : Lubna Khan News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 11:03 IST Chris Martin’s father Anthony Martin was spotted at Narendra Modi Stadium, enjoying Coldplay’s performance during their concert in Ahmedabad. reset Follow us on Google News Chris Martin's father Anthony Martin attends Coldplay concert in Ahmedabad. After three concerts in Mumbai’s DY Patil Stadium, British band Coldplay went on to perform two shows in Ahmedabad’s Narendra Modi Stadium. They finally wrapped up the India tour after last night’s performance. During the band’s 25th January performance in Ahmedabad, a fan spotted Coldplay’s lead vocalist Chris Martin’s father Anthony Martin enjoying the concert at the stadium. He was seen smiling and proudly recording while his son performed on stage. A video shared by a fan who attended Coldplay’s Ahmedabad concert shows Anthony Martin in a pink shirt. He took out his camera to record Chris Martin’s spectacular performance. He was seen smiling, and having fun at Coldplay’s concert as he stood amidst thousands of fans. Sharing the video, the Instagram user wrote that Anthony Martin was standing, filming and dancing the entire time. Meanwhile, in one comment, he shared that Anthony was very humble. “he was amazing bhai. Very humble. Saw me and waved too," he wrote. He further added, “when the show started, an entourage of organisers come to scout the area. I thought they were technical guys doing audio check or something. Then they took pictures of the seats next to us. Didn’t expect that they were his scouts and Anthony Martin would come and sit NEXT TO US!!!!" Check out the video below! related stories View this post on Instagram A post shared by Manuj Goyal (@manujgoyal) Meanwhile, another Coldplay fan who gave a scooter ride to Chris Martin in Ahmedabad, met the singer’s dad Anthony Martin at the concert. He also shared pictures with him on Instagram, and wrote, “Attended @coldplay Chris Martin’s concert today and met his dad, Sir Anthony John Martin. He was totally wondering how it all happened and even asked, ‘The scooter guy is YOU?’ Such an unforgettable experience." Check it out below! View this post on Instagram A post shared by Malay Adalja (@malay_adalja) Coldplay held their final and biggest-ever concert in Ahmedabad on January 26, and it was also livestreamed on Disney+ Hotstar last night. As the India tour concluded, Coldplay penned a heartfelt note, in which they wrote that they had an unforgettable two weeks in India. Sharing a picture of the packed stadium in Ahmedabad, they wrote, “Thank you Ahmedabad, thank you India. We’ll never forget these two weeks. Your love and kindness will stay with us forever." tags : Chris Martin Coldplay Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 11:03 IST News movies Chris Martin’s Dad Anthony Martin Proudly Records His Son’s Performance At Coldplay Ahmedabad Concert | Video Read More

title: Neha Dhupia Mocks Elvish Yadav On Roadies, Rhea Chakraborty Tells Him 'Aapka Apna Dimaag Nahi Hai'
summary: Prince Narula, Neha Dhupia, Rhea Chakraborty, and Elvish Yadav are the 'Gang Leaders' on Roadies.
full_content: Neha Dhupia Mocks Elvish Yadav On Roadies, Rhea Chakraborty Tells Him 'Aapka Apna Dimaag Nahi Hai' Curated By : Chirag Sehgal News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 11:00 IST Prince Narula, Neha Dhupia, Rhea Chakraborty, and Elvish Yadav are the 'Gang Leaders' on Roadies. reset Follow us on Google News Neha Dhupia calls Elvish Yadav a 'student' of Prince Narula on Roadies. (Photos: Instagram) Neha Dhupia took a dig at Elvish Yadav in the recent episode of MTV Roadies Double Cross. Recently, the makers of the show released a promo in which Neha mocked Elvish and called him Prince Narula’s “student". “Tu Prince ko bohot achi tarah follow karta hai (You follow Prince nicely)," Neha said to which Elvish asked, “Kaise follow karta hu? (How do I follow)." Neha then explained, “Achi tarah follow karta hai tu Prince ko. Tu saari uski instructions leta hai (You follow him nicely and take all his instructions). You are a good student." related stories Neha’s statement even left Rhea Chakraborty stunned. “Yeh toh insult hai. She is insinuating that aapka apna dimaag nahi hai which is not good for a gang leader," Rhea said. Prince Narula also told Elvish that Neha was trying to break their brotherhood to which the YouTuber said, “Aise toh kayi aa gaye (There have been like her)." Watch the promo here . For the unversed, the 20th season of Roadies is titled ‘MTV Roadies Double Cross’. It will be hosted by Rannvijay Singha. Prince Narula, Neha Dhupia, Rhea Chakraborty, and Elvish Yadav are the ‘Gang Leaders’ on the show. Previously, Rannvijay Singha shared his excitement about the show in a statement and said, “‘MTV Roadies’ has always felt like home to me and being part of this milestone season is truly special. With the Double Cross theme, fans are in for the most intense and unpredictable ‘MTV Roadies’ journey yet. I am excited to reunite with Prince and Neha. And of course, I am all excited to work alongside Rhea and Elvish for the first time". Roadies premiered on January 11, 22025. title: Aamir Khan Reveals Sitaare Zameen Par Will Release On Christmas, Gives Major Update On Climax
summary: Aamir Khan has reunited with Darsheel Safary in Taare Zameen Par after 16 years.
full_content: Aamir Khan Reveals Sitaare Zameen Par Will Release On Christmas, Gives Major Update On Climax Curated By : Grace Cyril News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 10:34 IST Aamir Khan has reunited with Darsheel Safary in Taare Zameen Par after 16 years. reset Follow us on Google News Aamir Khan will be seen next in Sitaare Zameen Par. Bollywood’s perfectionist Aamir Khan is back with a double dose of nostalgia for us. The man who made us laugh, cry, and rethink our school days with Taare Zameen Par is now ready to sprinkle some more stardust with its sequel Sitaare Zameen Par. And here’s the cherry on top: it’s hitting theaters this Christmas. Aamir has reunited with actor Darsheel Safary, who portrayed the young Ishaan in Taare Zameen Par, after 16 years with the upcoming film. Aamir Khan recently attended the Republic Day 2025 celebrations at the Statue of Unity in Gujarat where he shared updates about his upcoming projects. At the event, Aamir was asked if any of his upcoming projects would be filmed in the state. To this, the actor revealed that the climax of Sitaare Zameen Par was shot in Vadodara, Gujarat. related stories He said, “The sequel to Taare Zameen Par is Sitaare Zameen Par, and the climax of that movie was shot in Vadodara." Reflecting on his long connection with the state, Aamir shared, “When I was young, many of my father’s films were shot in Gujarat. I was very small at that time, so I would come here. Today, all those memories have come rushing back. There have been a lot of changes in Vadodara. There are many luxurious buildings now, and the roads have improved significantly. When I first came here, I was probably around 12 years old. A lot of changes have taken place in this area since then." “Gujarat has been closely associated with filmmaking for a long time. It is a very vibrant place, with a strong connection to cinema, culture, and art. From the film industry’s side, we would definitely love to come here and shoot," he added. Sitaare Zameen Par follows the story of Ishaan’s journey. Aamir said that the film is set to release by the end of this year, aiming for Christmas. “My next film as a lead actor is Sitaare Zameen Par. We are trying to release it by the end of this year, on the occasion of Christmas. It is an entertaining film, I like the story. The shooting of the film has begun," he said. Apart from acting, Aamir is also producing Sitaare Zameen Par. Genelia D’Souza is expected to feature in a pivotal role. Christmas releases have always been Aamir’s turf (hello, Dangal and PK), and it seems like the Mr. Perfectionist + Santa vibes combo never fails. But wait, is it going to make us bawl like Taare Zameen Par? We’ll have to wait and watch. tags : aamir khan bollywood Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 10:34 IST News movies Aamir Khan Reveals Sitaare Zameen Par Will Release On Christmas, Gives Major Update On Climax Read More

title: Swwapnil Joshi Says He Won't Make A Film Like Baahubali In Marathi: 'That Is Not My...' | Exclusive
summary: Swwapnil Joshi, last seen in Jilabi, believes the lack of good writers is an universal issue, and that he plans to write in 2025.
full_content: Swwapnil Joshi Says He Won't Make A Film Like Baahubali In Marathi: 'That Is Not My...' | Exclusive Written By : Nishad Thaivalappil News18.com Edited By: Chirag Sehgal Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 10:26 IST Swwapnil Joshi, last seen in Jilabi, believes the lack of good writers is an universal issue, and that he plans to write in 2025. reset Follow us on Google News Swwapnil Joshi wants to put pen to paper this year and try his hands at writing a slice-of-life story. (Photo: Instagram) Swwapnil Joshi, who was last seen in Nitin Kamble’s Jilabi believes that the fact that there’s a dearth of good writers, is a universal issue. The actor-producer feels that films are a “writer-director medium" and that they are not an actor’s medium. “Good writing and good direction is what makes a film good. We [actors] bring people to the theatre. I am the device to get you to the theatre. Then after that, it is the story that appeals to you. This is why I always say that for any film, the weekend collection is my responsibility, but from Monday onwards, the film will speak for itself," he said in an exclusive interview with News18 Showsha. related stories The Mumbai-Pune-Mumbai actor stated that he feels “there are less writers overall". Adding to his point, he said, “Thankfully, we are going back to our roots now. We have stopped looking outside, and we have started looking within ourselves. I always say that I have done many rom-coms, and a lot of them have worked well, too. Ultimately, I have to say a Marathi story. People always ask me, ‘When will there be a film like Baahubali in Marathi?’ I always tell them that there will not be a film like Baahubali made in Marathi. Because that is not my story. I have to say stories from the Konkan region. I want to do stories on the country. I have to tell the stories of my people, my culture and traditions. Only if I present what is mine, will it look unique among the clutter. So, yes, that dearth is there, I agree." Having said that, does he plan to expand his wings in 2025 and do something new? “I would like to explore writing. I have always felt that I am not a person who will say that ‘you do not know to write’. I can say that with authority if I know how to write. Otherwise, it is too easy to point a finger at someone and say that the writing is bad or he makes horrible films. It is a very difficult process. I would want to write something. I want to write a slice-of-life story. Because that’s the closest to what I am as a person. Not essentially that it will become a film or not necessary for it to translate into something commercial, but I just want to test those waters," he concluded. tags : regional cinema Showsha Exclusives Swwapnil Joshi Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 10:18 IST News movies Swwapnil Joshi Says He Won't Make A Film Like Baahubali In Marathi: 'That Is Not My...' | Exclusive Read More

title: Veer Pahariya On Not Joining Politics Like 'Nana' Sushilkumar Shinde: ‘Didn’t Want People To…’ | Exclusive
summary: Veer Pahariya says coming from a political family means living a 'sheltered' life but he still managed to lead a regular childhood.
full_content: Veer Pahariya On Not Joining Politics Like 'Nana' Sushilkumar Shinde: ‘Didn’t Want People To…’ | Exclusive Reported By : Titas Chowdhury News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 10:08 IST Veer Pahariya says coming from a political family means living a 'sheltered' life but he still managed to lead a regular childhood. reset Follow us on Google News Veer Pahariya made his acting debut with Sky Force. Veer Pahariya’s acting debut in Sky Force has become the talk of the town. It’s no secret that he comes from one of the most powerful political families in the country. His maternal grandfather, Sushilkumar Shinde, was the Chief Minister of Maharashtra between 2003 and 2004. Veer’s maternal aunt, Praniti Shinde, is a member of the Lok Sabha. However, the young actor decided to not follow their footsteps and venture into politics. In an exclusive chat with News18 Showsha, Veer reveals the reason behind this decision. Talking about how he wanted to carve a niche for himself, he tells us, “People in my family have achieved so much and I knew that being in this family means being sheltered. Very early on in my life, I knew that I wanted to do something different. I always wanted to have my own identity, for as young as I can remember. When I walked into a room, I didn’t want people to know me for the family I come from. I wanted them to know me for who I am and what I bring to the table." related stories Walking down the memory lane, Veer says that hailing from a political family comes with its own disadvantages and yet he managed to lead a regular life as an adolescent. “When I was five or six, I knew that my life was extremely protected. There were a lot of reasons because of which we couldn’t do certain things. But I lived a very simple life. I don’t have too many friends and those that are, are very normal and simple people from all around the country," he remarks. According to him, getting enrolled in a boarding school in Haryana opened him up to a new world. And the friends he made there acclimatised him to a new life. “I feel like I’m connected to the cultural fabric and diversity of this country because of my friends, who come from different backgrounds. I, anyway, didn’t grow up in an urban setting like Mumbai or Delhi. The thing is, I’ve always been rebellious because I wanted to act," says Veer, who has been an assistant director in Bhediya. He further adds, “At a young age, I knew that I couldn’t live life in a certain setting with my family because one needs to really live life to become an actor. That’s why I put myself out there and did risky things right since childhood. And acting is something that came to me naturally – maybe five percent naturally and for the remaining, I had to really work hard. I don’t take anything for granted." And how has his family reacted to his portrayal of late Air Force officer Ajjamada Boppayya Devayya in Sky Force? “I got a very warm appreciation from my parents, nani, nana and close family members. Unfortunately, my dada passed away a month ago, so I couldn’t have him see the film. But he blessed me and I’ve it on WhatsApp and his words will remain very, very special. My family is very proud of me for being a part of Sky Force," states Veer. tags : bollywood Showsha Exclusives sushil kumar shinde veer pahariya Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 10:08 IST News movies Veer Pahariya On Not Joining Politics Like 'Nana' Sushilkumar Shinde: ‘Didn’t Want People To…’ | Exclusive Read More

title: Coldplay’s Heartfelt Post After Wrapping Up India Tour: 'We'll Never Forget These Two Weeks'
summary: Coldplay shared a picture of the packed stadium during their Ahmedabad concert last night. As the India tour concluded, the band wrote that these two weeks will remain unforgettable.
full_content: Coldplay’s Heartfelt Post After Wrapping Up India Tour: 'We'll Never Forget These Two Weeks' Curated By : Lubna Khan News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 10:03 IST Coldplay shared a picture of the packed stadium during their Ahmedabad concert last night. As the India tour concluded, the band wrote that these two weeks will remain unforgettable. reset Follow us on Google News Signing off after the phenomenal India tour, Coldplay shared a post reflecting on the two weeks they spent in India After their stellar concerts in Mumbai and Ahmedabad, British band Coldplay wrapped up their Music Of The Spheres India tour. They held their final and biggest-ever concert in Ahmedabad on January 26, and it was also livestreamed on Disney+ Hotstar, allowing fans to experience Chris Martin and other band members’ spectacular performances. As the India tour concluded, Coldplay penned a heartfelt note, in which they wrote that they had an unforgettable two weeks in India. Signing off after the phenomenal India tour, Coldplay shared a post on X (previously Twitter), reflecting on the two weeks they spent in India. Hours after their final concert in Ahmedabad, they shared a picture of the packed stadium lit up with dazzling lights and spectacular fireworks. They wrote, “Thank you Ahmedabad, thank you India. We’ll never forget these two weeks. Your love and kindness will stay with us forever (sic)," with a heart emoji. Check out their post below! related stories Thank you Ahmedabad, thank you India. We’ll never forget these two weeks. Your love and kindness will stay with us forever pic.twitter.com/vB4BfsfFKY — Coldplay (@coldplay) January 26, 2025 Coldplay held five concerts in India as part of the Music Of The Spheres World Tour. They concluded the India tour in Ahmedabad’s Narendra Modi Stadium on Sunday, and it reportedly became the most attended musical concert in Asia, with over 1.34 lakh people grooving together. Last night, Chris Martin left Indian fans awestruck after he delivered his rendition of Vande Mataram on the occasion of Republic Day. He was also seen speaking to the crowd in Hindi, and Gujarati. Apart from this, Chris Martin also invited a couple to join him on stage and perform ‘Everglow’ with him. Coldplay kicked off the India tour in Mumbai on January 18. The band performed at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai on January 18, 19 and 21, followed by concerts in Ahmedabad’s Narendra Modi Stadium on January 25 and 26. Apart from Chris Martin the band also consists of guitarist Jonny Buckland, bassist Guy Berryman, drummer percussionist Will Champion, and manager Phil Harvey. tags : Chris Martin Coldplay Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 10:03 IST News movies Coldplay’s Heartfelt Post After Wrapping Up India Tour: 'We'll Never Forget These Two Weeks' Read More

title: Swwapnil Joshi Wants To Work On 'Good' Films: 'Audience Will Forgive You For A Flop But...' | Exclusive
summary: Swwapnil Joshi, a prominent Marathi actor, emphasized the importance of creating good films over chasing success.
full_content: Swwapnil Joshi Wants To Work On 'Good' Films: 'Audience Will Forgive You For A Flop But...' | Exclusive Written By : Nishad Thaivalappil News18.com Edited By: Chirag Sehgal Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 09:56 IST Swwapnil Joshi, a prominent Marathi actor, emphasized the importance of creating good films over chasing success. reset Follow us on Google News Swwapnil Joshi was last seen as ACP Vijay Karmarkar in Jilabi. (Photo: Instagram) Swwapnil Joshi has been in the industry for over three decades, and it is safe to state that the actor has established himself among the stars of the Marathi film industry. Swwapnil gained widespread acclaim with Marathi television series like Eka Lagnachi Dusri Goshta and movies such as Duniyadari, Mumbai-Pune-Mumbai, and Mitwaa. In an exclusive interview with News18 Showsha, the actor-producer talked about his work stints in 2024 and shared that he had a good year, which also taught him several lessons. Talking about the same, he said, “I learn every year, but what has been underlying this year is that there is no alternative to hard work. This is a very clichéd thought or a very done-to-death thought, but it still holds a lot of value. There is no substitute for hard work. You have to work hard. If you were 100-not out, or even if you were out for zero. You cannot have any of this baggage when you come to the crease. It is a new day, new innings and you have to start from zero. You play your shots and play some good cricket. It is just like that." related stories The Navra Mazha Navsacha 2 actor went on to share that he does not believe in working only to be successful. “I used to put a lot of effort earlier thinking that this film should work, these numbers have to be broken, this territory should open up, etc. But with time I have realised that you should make good films. That is what the focus should be on. I have learnt this the hard way," he explained. The actor further stated that the “audience will forgive you for a flop film but not forgive you for a bad film". When asked about how he differentiates between the two, he responded, “You just get to know. The film talks to you. I genuinely feel that when you work for so long, you can sense when the film is being made. Either you get a feeling that this is going to be something big or that something is just off. If you are honestly into the [film], the film will communicate to you. You should know how to judge that. Easier said than done, but this is what I have learnt." On the work front, Swwapnil was last seen in Nitin Kamble’s Jilabi, where he played the role of a police officer. The movie highlighted Swwapnil in a fresh light as ACP Vijay Karmarkar. The film also starred Prasad Oak in a double role alongside Shivani Surve and Parna Pethe. tags : regional cinema Showsha Exclusives Swwapnil Joshi Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 09:56 IST News movies Swwapnil Joshi Wants To Work On 'Good' Films: 'Audience Will Forgive You For A Flop But...' | Exclusive Read More

title: Ananya Panday Meets 'Forever Fav Girl' Alia Bhatt At Sabyasachi's 25th Anniversary Runway Show
summary: Alia Bhatt and Ananya Panday were among the many celebrities at Sabyasachi Mukherjee's 25th anniversary runway show.
full_content: Ananya Panday Meets 'Forever Fav Girl' Alia Bhatt At Sabyasachi's 25th Anniversary Runway Show Published By : Lubna Khan Trending Desk Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 10:14 IST Alia Bhatt and Ananya Panday were among the many celebrities at Sabyasachi Mukherjee's 25th anniversary runway show. reset Follow us on Google News Ananya Panday chose a retro-style look while Alia Bhatt rocked a saree look. title: Why Mani Ratnam Couldn’t Bring Shah Rukh Khan And Kajol Together for Alai Payuthey
summary: Alai Payuthey went on to star R. Madhavan and Shalini. It was later remade in Hindi as Saathiya with Rani Mukerji and Vivek Oberoi.
full_content: Why Mani Ratnam Couldn’t Bring Shah Rukh Khan And Kajol Together for Alai Payuthey Curated By : Grace Cyril News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 09:46 IST Alai Payuthey went on to star R. Madhavan and Shalini. It was later remade in Hindi as Saathiya with Rani Mukerji and Vivek Oberoi. reset Follow us on Google News Mani Ratnam wanted to make Alai Payuthey with Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol. Now picture this: Shah Rukh Khan, the King of Romance, and Kajol, the queen of our 90s hearts, in Alai Payuthey. It’s a Bollywood dream, isn’t it Well, Mani Ratnam almost made it happen until it didn’t! The filmmaker revealed that he had initially thought of making his 2000 hit Alai Payuthey with Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol. However, he had to can the idea as he was unable to crack the climax of the film. During an open forum at the G5A Retrospective, the legendary filmmaker dropped a little behind-the-scenes nugget. He said, “What I had planned to do with Shah Rukh was Alai Payuthey. I wanted to do it with Shah Rukh and Kajol and I told him the story and he agreed. But I had not cracked the last element of the story. If you’ve seen Alai Payuthey it is built around one day and we keep going back to that one day, and when the accident happens and the wife is missing, and he is searching through it. So, that element I didn’t have it at that point in time. So, we shifted to Dil Se." related stories Mani Ratnam further claimed that he finally cracked the ending of Alai Payuthey while making his 1998 film, Dil Se (starring Shah Rukh and Manisha Koirala). “Once I was finishing Dil Se, I was able to solve this problem (with Alai Payuthey), and I was still interested in doing it (film)," the director added. Talking about the remake of the film, Saathiya, Mani Ratnam said every film goes through several changes during every step of the filmmaking. “You are never sure you got it correct.. . You are still trying. Even when you’ve written fully, when you shoot, you are looking for something more because it’s still getting constructed," Ratnam said Alai Payuthey was a Tamil romantic musical that went on to star R Madhavan and Shalini. Later, it was remade by Shaad Ali in Hindi as Saathiya with Rani Mukerji and Vivek Oberoi. The storyline of the film revolved around a couple who elope to get married. However, things take a bad turn when cracks start to appear in their marriage. While we didn’t get to see SRK-Kajol in Alai Payuthey, we’ll always have Madhavan and Shalini bringing that magic to life. Moral of the story? Sometimes, even the best plans need a little more time to simmer. tags : bollywood Kajol mani ratnam Shah Rukh Khan Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 09:46 IST News movies Why Mani Ratnam Couldn’t Bring Shah Rukh Khan And Kajol Together for Alai Payuthey Read More

title: Veer Pahariya Calls Brother Shikhar And Himself ‘Simple’; Adds ‘Janhvi and Khushi Are My…’ | Exclusive
summary: Veer Pahariya discusses his relationship with Shikhar Pahariya. He adds being away from the public eye, Shikhar is 'inaccessible'.
full_content: Veer Pahariya Calls Brother Shikhar And Himself ‘Simple’; Adds ‘Janhvi and Khushi Are My…’ | Exclusive Reported By : Titas Chowdhury News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 09:38 IST Veer Pahariya discusses his relationship with Shikhar Pahariya. He adds being away from the public eye, Shikhar is 'inaccessible'. reset Follow us on Google News Veer Pahariya recently made his acting debut with Sky Force. Veer Pahariya’s debut film, Sky Force, earned more than Rs 15.30 crore on its first day. The young actor has also been winning praises for holding his win against superstar Akshay Kumar in the film. As love continues pouring in, in an exclusive chat with News18 Showsha, Veer reveals that he hasn’t had ‘the time to sink it all in’. He tells us, “I haven’t eaten or slept in days. I don’t know if you can see it in my face (laughs). But I’m very, very happy about it because I was waiting for it. I gave my life and soul to Sky Force. It’s been a journey of more than three years." He further adds, “I may have been working on films for many years but there were long periods of waiting too. I waited for a time like this when I wouldn’t have the time to do anything else except for work. I’m very happy with the rejections I had and the tests I had go through because they made me stronger. I think as an artist, it’s okay to be in love with your work but your work also needs to bring in money because there are producers investing in your film. I’m very grateful to everyone for accepting me." related stories The reaction from his family has been overwhelming too, including grandfather Sushilkumar Shinde, the former Chief Minister of Maharashtra. “My family is very proud of me for being a part of Sky Force," states Veer. And speaking about his family, it can be rightly said that Veer and his elder brother, Shikhar Pahariya, are the paparazzi’s darlings. They’ve often been spotted out and about attending high-profile events. How would Veer describe his equation his Shikhar, a horse rider and a professional polo player? “He’s not in the public eye. He isn’t very accessible. To me, he’s a friend figure. He’s someone I can go to if I need personal or professional advice. We talk about everything and we’re very close. Both he and I are very normal. We’re very simple people. We don’t care about materialistic things. Experiences are more important for us," he remarks. Shikhar’s profession may keep him away from the limelight but he often hits headlines for his relationship with Janhvi Kapoor, who has been showering praises on Veer for his debut. Talking about her, he says, “Janhvi and Khushi (Kapoor) are my first actor friends in the industry." As for Khushi, his contemporary, who marked her debut a while ago, Veer asserts that he doesn’t look at the new crop of actors as his competition. “I think it’s very good and important for new talents to come in. I don’t look at it as competition. It’s more like a collaboration. If I’m able to learn something from another artist and they’ve their unique style and voice, it will only help me and the industry in getting more viewers. I think, the more, the merrier," shares Veer, who was an assistant director on Varun Dhawan’s Bhediya. tags : bollywood Janhvi Kapoor khushi kapoor Shikhar Pahariya Showsha Exclusives veer pahariya Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 09:38 IST News movies Veer Pahariya Calls Brother Shikhar And Himself ‘Simple’; Adds ‘Janhvi and Khushi Are My…’ | Exclusive Read More

title: Shahid Kapoor Says 'My Son Dominates Me, Daughter Has Full Control'
summary: Shahid Kapoor recently opened up about how his children, Misha Kapoor and Zain Kapoor, boss him around.
full_content: Shahid Kapoor Says 'My Son Dominates Me, Daughter Has Full Control' Curated By : Grace Cyril News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 09:27 IST Shahid Kapoor recently opened up about how his children, Misha Kapoor and Zain Kapoor, boss him around. reset Follow us on Google News Shahid Kapoor has now opened up about fatherhood. Looks like Shahid Kapoor has surrendered to the tiny rulers of his household. Recently, in an interview, the Bollywood star spilled the beans on his parenting struggles—err, experiences as he revealed how his kids boss him around. Shahid Kapoor and Mira Rajput have two children: Misha Kapoor and Zain Kapoor. The man who’s won millions of hearts on-screen is apparently no match for the two little bosses calling the shots at home. Speaking about his kids at SCREEN Live event in Mumbai, Shahid admitted, “My son tries to dominate me. I think that is usually a dynamic of girls and boys. Boys are like aggressive and loud, ‘Papa this and that.’ But quietly my daughter has full control over me. Without saying anything, she has full control over me. Quietly she gets the job done and I think girls are far better in doing that. My daughter is my soft spot. She doesn’t even try that hard, but I’m always ready to do whatever she wants." related stories Shahid Kapoor further revealed how his wife, Mira Rajput, makes full use of it. “Now, Mira understands this so well that if she wants something done, she comes to me through Misha," he quipped. Shahid also talked about his parenting philosophy and said, “As a father I am learning and I am trying to be honest. I like to observe, what they want and what is their weaknesses and strength. It’s important to teach them the basics, it’s combination of all that. Let children be. They are born off you, they aren’t yours. They aren’t your property. They are their own individual. You are just the caretaker. You just have to given them what they need." Shahid Kapoor and Mira Rajput got married in 2015. They welcomed their daiughter Misha in 2016. Two years later, in 2018, Mira gave birth to their son Zain. Shahid’s parenting reality is every dad’s story – caught between the sass of a queen (Misha) and the demands of a little dictator (Zain). Raise your hands if you feel the same, dads! title: Maharashtra Minister Objects To Vicky Kaushal's Dance Scene In Chhaava: 'We Will Not Let It Release'
summary: Previously, a descendant of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj also expressed his desire to watch the full film before its release.
full_content: Maharashtra Minister Objects To Vicky Kaushal's Dance Scene In Chhaava: 'We Will Not Let It Release' Curated By : Chirag Sehgal News18.com Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 09:27 IST Previously, a descendant of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj also expressed his desire to watch the full film before its release. reset Follow us on Google News Vicky Kaushal's Chhaava will hit theatres on February 14, 2025. (Photo: Instagram) Maharashtra minister Uday Samant has expressed disappointment with Vicky Kaushal’s upcoming movie, Chhaava. On Sunday, the minister raised objections to a scene in the movie where Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj is shown dancing. He said the scene should be removed and suggested that the film be reviewed by historians and scholars. “If they raise objections, we will not let it be released," Samant said while speaking to the media and then threatened the block the film’s release. “The movie shows Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj dancing. The director should cut this part. This movie should be shown to historians and scholars. If they raise objections, we will not let it be released," he added. related stories This comes hours after the minister also took to his X (formerly Twitter) handle and praised the makers for showcasing the life of Sambhaji Maharaj via their film. However, he also mentioned that a film like this might face backlash if there are any “objectionable" scenes. “It is a matter of joy that a Hindi film based on the life of Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, the protector of religion and protector of freedom, is being made. Such efforts are necessary to make the world understand the history of Chhatrapati. However, many have expressed their opinions that there are some objectionable scenes in this film. Our position is that this film should not be released without first showing it to experts and knowledgeable people. Anything that will harm the honor of the Maharaj will not be tolerated," Samant wrote. “Our position is that the producers and directors of the film should take immediate action in this regard and remove anything objectionable. A further decision will be taken after watching the film; otherwise, this film will not be allowed to be released!" he added. Prior to Samant, in an interaction with PTI, Sambhajiraje Chhatrapati, a descendant of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and former Rajya Sabha MP, also expressed his desire to watch the full film before its release. “I also offered to connect them with historians to address inaccuracies to ensure this significant story is presented authentically to audiences worldwide," he said. Chhaava is a historical drama that revolves around the life of Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, the son of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. In the film, Vicky Kaushal is set to portray the character of Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, the eldest son of the Maratha empire’s founder. The film also stars Rashmika Mandanna, Akshaye Khanna, Ashutosh Rana, and Divya Dutta in key roles. Chhaava will hit theatres on February 14, 2025. tags : Vicky Kaushal Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 09:27 IST News movies Maharashtra Minister Objects To Vicky Kaushal's Dance Scene In Chhaava: 'We Will Not Let It Release' Read More

title: Anil Kapoor's Big Shoutout To 'Dear Friend' Shekhar Kapur For Padma Bhushan Feat
summary: Giving him a shoutout, Anil Kapoor wrote a touching congratulatory message for Shekhar Kapur on Instagram Stories.
full_content: Anil Kapoor's Big Shoutout To 'Dear Friend' Shekhar Kapur For Padma Bhushan Feat Published By : Lubna Khan Trending Desk Last Updated: January 27, 2025, 10:15 IST Giving him a shoutout, Anil Kapoor wrote a touching congratulatory message for Shekhar Kapur on Instagram Stories. reset Follow us on Google News Anil Kapoor will be seen next in Subedaar. (Photo Credits: Instagram) Shekhar Kapur is a celebrated name in the Indian film industry. The filmmaker, over the years, has wowed audiences with his iconic creations like Masoom, Mr India and Bandit Queen. In a latest development, he has been conferred with the prestigious Padma Bhushan award. Among others, Bollywood veteran Anil Kapoor showered praise for the director, calling him a ‘dear friend’. Giving him a shoutout, Anil Kapoor wrote a touching congratulatory message for Shekhar Kapur on Instagram Stories. With a bunch of throwback glimpses which also featured late actress Sridevi, the actor penned, “Congratulations to my dear friend @shekharkapur on receiving the Padma Bhushan! Your brilliance and unwavering dedication to cinema is truly an inspiration. This honour is a testament to your incredible journey, and I couldn’t be happier Shekhar." related stories Previously, Shekhar Kapur expressed gratitude to the government for bestowing him with such an honour. “What an honour! Am humbled that the Government of India has considered me to be deserving of a #Padmanbhushan. Hopefully this award will make me strive harder to serve the Industry that I am part of, and the beautiful Nation that I am so fortunate to belong to. Thank you also to our film audiences of India, for I am because you are," he mentioned on X. What an honour! Am humbled that the Government of India has considered me to be deserving of a #Padmanbhushan . Hopefully this award will make me strive harder to serve the Industry that I am part of, and the beautiful Nation that I am so fortunate to belong to. Thank you also… — Shekhar Kapur (@shekharkapur) January 25, 2025 The announcement came on the eve of Republic Day when Prime Minister Narendra Modi revealed the names for Padma Awards 2025. The highest civilian honours of the country include seven Padma Vibhushan, 19 Padma Bhushan and 113 Padma Shri decorations. Speaking of Anil Kapoor’s work, he will appear next in Subedaar. While the actor will play the lead character of Subedaar Arjun Singh, Radhika Madan will portray the role of his daughter. Helmed by Suresh Triveni, Subedaar has been bankrolled by Vikram Malhotra in collaboration with Suresh Triveni, and Anil Kapoor himself. tags : Anil Kapoor bollywood Shekhar Kapur Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 27, 2025, 09:23 IST News movies Anil Kapoor's Big Shoutout To 'Dear Friend' Shekhar Kapur For Padma Bhushan Feat Read More
